author: {'steamid': '76561198278002834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1690491056}
review:
Игра прекрасна, но ей не хватает смысла. На красивом космосе, копании ресурсов, и строительстве модульного корабля далеко не уедешь. 

Может игра не об этом, но лично мне не хватает противоборствующих сторон, завоевания с возможно перекрашиванием галактики, сильного ИИ противника и т.д.. Возможно я хочу игру, смесь Space Ranger и x4 foundations(но в 2д).. Ведь по сути данная ниша пуста. 

Авансом такой отзыв, а все остальное моя субъективщина, которая возможно и не соответствует сути и направлению проекта,

author: {'steamid': '76561198054440184', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1710104870}
review:
No because I just checked the store page and they're selling this early access project at full market price.

Folks, this game has been out for a decade. I bought it Dec 09, 2015 for $7.99. Now it's twenty bucks.

It clearly has glitches that are impeding gameplay. I just came here to leave this review in frustration because it crashed after trying to load an autosave...after smashing into an asteroid lol.

While there are definitely things to enjoy (while it works) like mining and collecting resources, building a capital ship to process the resources, and to do a little battling, A LITTLE mind you, there's really not much else to do.

The 2-D plane orbital mechanics are just perfect for this sort of game but like I said, it's unfinished. STILL! Still after it was "released" on Nov 20, 2014 it can't be trusted to work properly.

One of the most aggravating things is the tutorial which comes and goes on a whim. It showed up the first couple times I started a new game but because there's a learning curve, I restarted to try again. Suddenly, it wasn't there anymore. I checked the options both in-game and on the title screen but there's nothing there to turn the tutorial back on. And THEN, get this: I'm playing, trying to figure out how to build and what I need when the tutorial suddenly shows up again! Now, it whizzes through a few screens because of the objectives I already completed and then will wait for me to do something I've already done! "Alright, I'll just build this thing and then delete it." Fine. That worked. But then it introduces a battle where after you have to repair your ship. This worked ONCE, the first time I played (recently). It highlights a button on the bottom to repair your ship which orders the drones to fly out and do so. The next few times (when the tutorial actually appeared) it would improperly highlight the button for the inventory! Well, when you click that, it doesn't repair the ship, it pulls up the inventory! GASP! Then the tutorial just stays stuck there until you repair your ship. Or crash. Or delete the game and go play Dyson Sphere Program which I'm about to do after I post this thing.

$20? You got some nerve, devs. Either charge for LESS than what I paid and leave this 10 year old project as is or GET BACK TO WORK!!!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198009604863', 'num_games_owned': 1463, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 691, 'last_played': 1704466138}
review:
I've given this enough time. It's been 10 years. It's terrible.

The game is about building space craft and the building tools are terrible, if you want to readjust things it's so tedious that it makes you want to edit your ships as little as possible. If you remove the control module then you lose ownership of the ship and can't do anything with it so you'd best use the ship editor to create your ship but that causes the game to freeze some of the time.
Even then if you're trying to remove pieces of your ship you best be good at Russian Roulette because the piece that gets removed can sometime be random, but that's okay because you can just place it again.. unless it's the control module, which in that case if you place your control module back where it was then say goodbye to your whole design cause you obviously want to start a new ship, why else would you place a control module?
This is on top of the fact that you can build vertically but sometimes the increments in height mean you need to place pieces during the camera transition between two levels because they don't match the increments.
developer_response:
Thank you for your feedback. We have just released an update that addresses the specified issues and should resolve all of them.


> if you want to readjust things it's so tedious that it makes you want to edit your ships as little as possible

You can press F2 to enter the isolated ship editor, where you can freely rebuild everything and then apply the design to the real ship with a single click. Drones will handle all the work. In the latest update, we have also improved the usability of that editor.


> If you remove the control module then you lose ownership of the ship

It is not necessary, you can simply place a new command module anywhere to replace the old one with the new one. However, it is a valid point that the deletion of the command module ruins the ship, so we have added a warning message to prevent that.


> the piece that gets removed can sometime be random

That should be impossible, and we have never received a bug report about that issue. Perhaps you accidentally hovered the cursor over another module and didn't notice. The "Remove" button removes the selected module or the module hovered by the cursor if no other module is selected. The new warning message should prevent accidental deletion of command modules.


> you need to place pieces during the camera transition between two levels because they don't match

You can hold Ctrl to quickly place a module where you want without changing the altitude using R/F keys. Additionally, we have improved the R/F functionality, and now when you hold Shift, you can change altitude smoothly and select any desired value.


More information about latest update can be found here:
https://store.steampowered.com/news/app/330460/view/3976182006221059069

author: {'steamid': '76561197992060028', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4479, 'last_played': 1707573000}
review:
[h1]Viel Potential, noch wenig Inhalt![/h1]

Zur Zeit läuft das Spiel bei mir stabil, hat aber etwas wenig Content - der wird aber sicher folgen, wie das angekündigt wurde. Braucht halt seine Zeit unter den aktuellen Umständen.

Die Tragik liegt hier nicht in dem Roll-back, sondern daran, dass es ein Russisch-Ukrainisches Entwicklerteam ist, das in einem realen Krieg (!) zu überleben versucht.
Wenn jemand das Team unterstutzen möchte, bitte kauft das Game, legt es beiseite und hofft auf das Beste.

Zur Zeit ist das Game eher eine Alpha.
- Missionen verschwinden nach einen Re-load. Sie sind aber wichtig für das Fortkommen im Spiel.
- [FIXED] Im Baumodus erhalte ich oft Schiffsduplikate am Kartenrand, die nicht zu bewegen sind, aber als Schiffe zählen.
- [FIXED] Wenn ich "on-the-fly" Schiffe bearbeite, drehen sie sich gerne um 180° (upside down) und nicht mehr zurück.
- [FIXED] Baut man in die Höhe, kann man ein Schiff nicht mehr andocken, weil die Positionen verschwinden.

Ich glaube daran, dass das Spiel potential hat und vernünftig fertig werden kann - wer ein kleines, ruhiges, aber mit viel Liebe gemachtes Spiel spielen möchte, sollte zugreifen.
Erwarte nichts und es wird dir ein paar Stunden Freude bringen können.


TLDR: Kauf das Game um die Entwickler zu unterstützen, aber erwarte kein AAA Game. Ist ne Alpha - macht aber Spaß.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990872330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 579, 'last_played': 1703538154}
review: The game would be great but the controls are rubbish. Trying to build a ship is like guessing where your cursor is and the grid is about 1/4 off so while moving from a different height you have to click while its moving otherwise you'll be too high or to low. Even after all these years, its still basic controls arnt good. Once the controls and such are correct, the game will be so much more enjoyable.
developer_response: You can hold the Ctrl key while positioning a preview of the module, and it will automatically attach to mounting points near the cursor. This provides an easy way to place the module at different altitudes without using the R/F keys.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988847628', 'num_games_owned': 168, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3875, 'last_played': 1702342848}
review:
Давно наблюдаю за игрой. Развивается. На мой взгляд в лучшую сторону.
Пусть она отклонилась от своего первоначального замысла, это не отменяет самого главного, это про космос. Со временем мелкие шероховатости уйдут. Разработчик отзывчивый и делает всё возможное!
developer_response:
Тек’ма’те, Тилк. Мы приносим прощения за такую ситуацию. Эта проблема в игре появилась в прошлом обновлении и мы её уже исправили, теперь все должно работать нормально и можно продолжать сражаться с Гоа'улдами.

UPD: Благодарю!

author: {'steamid': '76561198192949942', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1701175990}
review:
I genuinely want to love this game but the plane shifting bug makes the TUTORIAL impossible.

the game takes place on a 2D plane, but enemies and your own ship will slightly shift off plane as though it were 3D, and given your starting weapon, the mining laser, does not have the ability to aim, you cannot hit the enemies without nerdpoleing your mining laser up or down, which shifts your center of mass, thus screwing up your ability to fly straight even more. not to mention you have limited fuel for all this so while you are running way  trying to rebuild your ship your fuel runs out mid fight. 

Until the dev fixes this massive gamebreaking bug, im sticking with a dislike.
developer_response:
It was a bug that appeared in the previous version, and we have already fixed it.
Now everything should be working fine.
We apologize that you encountered such an unpleasant gaming experience.

review:
Вырезали всё что не надо было вырезать, добавили то что не окупает то что вырезали. Теперь это просто урезанная 3d версия starsector. Ну, вот в starsector и переехал, вернусь через 5 лет когда разработчики выпустят следующую обнову.

На самом деле это достаточно неплохая схема, сначала ты делаешь игру так как хочется и нравится многим, потому спустя долго время когда у большинства игроков наиграно более 2 часов просто вырезаешь пол игры.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972293895', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2198, 'last_played': 1698668020}
review:
Twórcy przeszli w stan uśpienia kilka lat temu i nagle powrócili. Jednak kiedy wrócili, zamiast kontynuować od miejsca, w którym przerwali, zdecydowali, że muszą wkrótce opublikować aktualizację, a naprawienie funkcji, które wcześniej opracowali, będzie wymagało zbyt wiele pracy, więc usunęli je wszystkie.

Czy spodobał Ci się pomysł gry wieloosobowej? Szkoda, że już go nie ma
Czy podobał Ci się pomysł imperium handlowego? Szkoda, że już go nie ma
Spodobał Ci się pomysł lądowania na planetach? Tak, to też zniknęło

Czy lubisz budować statki i wykonywać misje, aby zbudować więcej statków, aby móc budować więcej statków i budować statki? Ja też nie.

Twierdzą, że funkcje zostaną „ponownie dodane” w przyszłości, być może, ale mało prawdopodobne. Nie wiem, co wydarzyło się za kulisami i naprawdę mnie to nie obchodzi. Jestem tylko facetem, który dał się oszukać i dał pieniądze kłamcom. Prawdopodobnie będę unikać wszystkich przyszłych produktów.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995212722', 'num_games_owned': 1108, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 2591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2591, 'last_played': 1700395181}

author: {'steamid': '76561197999708314', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1103, 'last_played': 1701620283}
review:
Après 18 h de jeu, en mode aero, voici mon avis :
- graphiquement le jeu est trés beau
- le principe de minage / construction est plaisant
- le principe de combat et prise de poste est interressant

cependant :
- encore de nombreux beug, qui nécessite de relancer le jeu
- je n'ai pas retrouvé le système de gestion des connexions entre les modules ((vue sur les rares vidéos de youtube)
- A quoi sert la prise des stations...pas d'économie...
- après avoir ajouté quelques canons ont prend vite l’ascendant sur les rares vaisseaux ennemis...

il faudrait :
- retrouver la mécanique d'un jeu du style elite dangerous l'approche en vue de dessus en gardant les combats / transport / économie serait top
- une fois une zone conquise..pourquoi ne pas créer des route commerciale avec de drone...

Enfin voici mon avis..je suis peu être passé à coté de quelque chose...le mode orbit est assez difficile quand au maniement du vaisseau (mais à le mérite d'être surement proche du réalisme.

un jeu a très fort potentiel..mais que je ne conseillerai pas suite à ma propre perception de celui-ci.

review:
I am going to recommend  based on potential only, the game has vastly improved since my purchase but needs serious work on bug fixes , several times I was unable to load the  most recent auto save don't know whats causing it but it waste my time waiting for it to load and nothing happens. I think a better snap to grid construction theme would make things go smoother .
Moving up and down seems to difficult to lock on to a connector the component flashes green for a moment and is gone. That being said, given the games progress and the Devs dealing with war I didn't  think i would see any improvements but was pleasantly surprised to see the improvements in the tutorial. For now at least the game is playable , I could not say that a year ago. Keep up the great work guys hopefully things get better for you soon

author: {'steamid': '76561197964363507', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1624328370}
review:
The devs went dormant a few years ago and suddenly came back.  However when they came back instead of picking up where they left off they instead decided they have to put out an update soon and too much work would be required to fix the features they previously developed so they axed them all.

Did you like the idea of multiplayer? Too bad its gone
Did you like the idea of a trade empire?  To bad its gone
Did you like the idea of landing on planets?  Yep thats gone too

Do you like building ships and doing missions to build more ships so that you can build more ships to build ships?  Me neither.

They claim the features will be "re-added" in the future, possibly, maybe, but unlikely.  I dont know what happened behind the scenes and I dont really care, Im just a guy that got duped into giving money to liars.  I will likely be avoiding all future products.
developer_response:
Multiplayer will be reintroduced as soon as all critical bugs are resolved. You certainly don't want a multiplayer mode riddled with bugs in the core game.

Regarding the Trading Empire feature, it's a pretty straightforward decision. We had two options:

1. Release the game without it.
2. The game may never be released at all due to the extremely high technical complexity of implementing this feature, which could lead to the game being abandoned.

This is not a lie, it's a strategic choice to ensure the game's quality and completion. Trading Empire never really functioned as intended; it was merely a glimpse of its theoretical potential. The game has always centered around ship construction, and this aspect remains intact and is now even better than before.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033281087', 'num_games_owned': 385, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 939, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 939, 'last_played': 1588229998}
review: Keeps removing the good features. Cant figure out how to fix multiplayer, so they just remove it.
developer_response: Not removed, but temporarily hidden in order to release the update as quickly as possible. As soon as we fix the critical bugs in the single-player game, we will bring back the multiplayer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022288817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 9926, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9642, 'last_played': 1699475243}
review:
So, jetzt nach dem Capital Ships Update muss ich auch mal ein paar Pro/Kontras loswerden.

Pros:

Die Idee die am Anfang da war, war eine interessante und auch spannende Art Schiffe zu bauen. Man kann Schiffe mit Schilden, Waffen, und Produktionsmodulen bauen. Zusätzlich dazu erforscht man neue Technologien und nimmt Stationen ein.

So und jetzt kommen die Kontras:

Dieses Spiel ist ein einziger BUG

- beim bauen der eigenen Schiffe fliegen sie einfach ohne Grund auseinander
- gegnerische Schiffe stehen dumm rum und machen nix
- Baudrohnen reagieren einfach mal nicht
- das eigene Schiff bewegt sich beim Flug aus der Y Achse und bewegt sich immer weiter nach unten.
- Das Konstruktionsmenu hat einfach einen Blackscreen. Strg+Alt+Entf hilft
- Gecrashte Spielstände - die würden wahrscheinlich bis zum jüngsten Tag laden.
- pure Langeweile nach dem Capital Ships Update (Gasmining, Handelsstationen, Treibstoffverbrauch, der Sinn von Solarkollektoren usw wurden komplett entfernt)
- Multiplayer? Steht jedenfalls da, funktioniert nur extrem schei....

Lange Rede, gar kein Sinn.

Nicht kaufen. Dieses "Spiel" ist seit 2014 in der Alphaphase

Nachtrag 08.11.23

Dieses Spiel ist ein einziger BUG

- beim bauen der eigenen Schiffe fliegen sie einfach ohne Grund auseinander: Gefixt
- gegnerische Schiffe stehen dumm rum und machen nix
- Baudrohnen reagieren einfach mal nicht: Gefixt
- das eigene Schiff bewegt sich beim Flug aus der Y Achse und bewegt sich immer weiter nach unten: Gefixt
- Das Konstruktionsmenu hat einfach einen Blackscreen. Strg+Alt+Entf hilft
- Gecrashte Spielstände - die würden wahrscheinlich bis zum jüngsten Tag laden: Gefixt
- pure Langeweile nach dem Capital Ships Update (Gasmining, Handelsstationen, Treibstoffverbrauch, der Sinn von Solarkollektoren usw wurden komplett entfernt)
- Multiplayer? Steht jedenfalls da, funktioniert nur extrem schei....

4 Kontras innerhalb 8 Tagen beseitigt. Na immerhin

author: {'steamid': '76561198037469176', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1888, 'last_played': 1699040420}
review:
I am giving Celestial Command a positive review simply because the small team of three people developing it still has not given up on their project, despite years of struggling with the development process and at least one of them being directly affected by the current war in Ukraine. 

As for the game: There are many cool features and ideas so far which make a good foundation for further development. However, at the current state, it's neither feature-complete nor polished and it remains unclear how exactly its development is going to progress.
A lot of what Celestial Command is trying to do is rather complex and ambitious (for example having a separate mode that simulates orbital mechanics), and it's hardly a surprise that it is taking a lot of time to develop with such a small team.

I recommend to buy this game if you want to support the developers and help them fund their project.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067137033', 'num_games_owned': 709, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 2798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2798, 'last_played': 1650517963}
review: Было очень интересно, пока от простых кораблей не перешли к сложным 3д моделям. Покупал как простую атмосферную игрушку с орбитальными механиками, простоту потихоньку выпиливают. Жаль.
developer_response:
На самом деле, наоборот. Пока мы разрабатывали версию 0.9 мы планировали сделать полное 3D, то есть ставить двигатели со всех сторон, летать вверх и вниз, и так далее.
Но обнаружили что такая игра достаточно сложна в управлении и слишком далеко ушла от первоначальной идеи 2D с простым управлением, так что мы решили вернуться к идее 2D но сохранив возможность 3D строительства, которое совсем не обязательно. За плоские корабли не накладывается никаких штрафов, но зато появляется возможность ставить орудия сверху как у настоящих кораблей, что у нас просили уже очень давно.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127948791', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 15, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1711643809}
review: Итак честный обзор по данной игре без предвзятого мнения как у многих бывает. 1: Интересная ли игра, ну если вы фанат игр где строишь корабли, станции и прочее то да она тебе понравиться. 2: В освоении тут тоже все довольно понятно, собираешь ресурсы с астероидов, каждый из них подписан с каким он ресурсом, вполне понятный интерфейс, куча аспектов  за которыми надо следить, присутствует гравитация инерция и прочие приколюхи которые разнообразят твой игровой опыт в игре. Да может показаться что разработчики забили болт на игру и игра мертва, но уверяю вас, она живее всех живых, дайте время им и они доведут до ума эту конфетку. 3 локализация присутствует частичная, повторюсь "ЧАСТИЧНАЯ" но это ни коем боком не мешает насладиться игрой, а то что некоторые мальчики ставят дизлайк только потому что нет локализации то я бы сопоставил бы это как расизм XD но не суть. С чем сравнить игру, хм s.p.a.z обе части наверное  и на подобии. Ну а так игра в основном очень хорошая, да есть пару вопросов с коолизией у союзных NPC но это так малость, а так масштабы игры меня радуют. Ставлю 10 из 10, (P.s для умников которые орут что игра говно и она вышла 2014 года, ребят возьмите в пример Star Citizen 2011 год разработка вышла, и какие то кривые  БЕТА тесты закрытые, люди ждут деньги уплочены а игра на релизе будет разочарованием скорее всего, а тут вам дают возможность поучаствовать в создании игры, на то и ранний доступ, и на минутку 3 человека стоят за этой игрой, так что же не надо тут умников включать XD)

author: {'steamid': '76561198010541939', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 777, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1683828536}
review:
Убогая какашка. Разраб попрошайничает прямо в главном меню клянча деньги на свой патреон. 
Ну и плюс разраб абузит отзывы в стим, остановив разработку и закономерно получив отрицательные отзывы он перевёл все отзывы к игре в "обзоры не по теме" и это держится уже больше года. 
От обучения больше вреда чем пользы, не расскажут даже как управлять кораблём, просто тыкай наугад на всё подряд авось справишься с тем что от тебя хочет игра. 
При начале новой игры предлагают первым делом построить станцию, но при этом нет ни единого намёка на то как ей передать ресурсы что бы началось строительство.
А ещё в игре музыки нету.
Поиграйте лучше в Avorion: https://store.steampowered.com/app/445220/Avorion/

review:
Good game, a lot of complex ideas mixed into one nice package, if your looking for third person space strategy, building and spacecraft control then I would recommend this.

Authors note: currently the devs updates have been short due to the Ukraine war as two had to move out of Russia and one is in Ukraine and has intermittent power. Buy the game maybe support them on patreon.com/celestialcommand any help gets the game we want sooner.

author: {'steamid': '76561199032346217', 'num_games_owned': 42, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1059, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 742, 'last_played': 1700191942}
review:
En Primer Lugar les advierto que este juego es de los que ahuevo debes pasarte el tutorial ( No Te Obligan ) pero casi que mejor hacerlo por que hay mecánicas bastante difíciles de entender principalmente el comercio.
El Juego Tiene muy buenas mecánicas y sabe diferenciarse de su genero, no es el típico juego de naves con cámara desde arriba qui hay un gran elemento de 3D con vista 2D, Suena raro lo se pero una vez lo pruebas se hace muy cómodo pasando 15 minutos.
Otra cosa a resaltar es que el juego esta en desarrollo aun y no esperen mucho mas del contenido que te ofrece actualmente, Eh visto a muchos llorones quejarse de que no hay español o que las mecánicas del modo órbita son difíciles. 
en lo del idioma español solo puedo decirte que no seas imbéci, ellos no hablan español y mucho menos tendrán el juego totalmente traducido considerando que son 3 personas con muy poca experiencia y que por obvias razones no saben exactamente que significa cada cosa en español, pero si realmente quieres que este juego mejore en lugar de quejarte y tirarle mierda en steam pásate por el foro de desarrollo y ayuda a traducirlo para te sea mas cómodo jugarlo.
Ahora en cuanto a la mecánica de la órbita es muy sencillo, cambia el modo a vuelo, cuando creas una partida te da 2 opciones la primera el modo vuelo donde solamente tendrás que moverte por ahí como si tuvieras una nave espacial de ciencia ficción por que si quieres algo mas apegado a la realidad esta el modo órbita donde literalmente tendrás algo similar a una estación espacial, el cual a decir verdad esta muy bien recreado mis Dieces a los desabolladores

Ahora va lo que en mi opinión falla del juego, comenzando con las escalas del Generador de Combustible y La Refinería de Minerales las cuales en mi opinión deberían ser miniaturizadas ya que estas son muy estorbosas en ambos modos de juego 
y no son muy eficientes que digamos en mi opinión deberían de hacerlos mas grandes mediante son mas eficientes
Tambien al juego no le vendría mal el añadir mas construcciones como puertos de naves miniatura a modo de defensa o exploración o agregar un sistema de diplomacia

author: {'steamid': '76561197998384845', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1045, 'last_played': 1676672506}
review:
It's one of those games that you're better off waiting of it to be finished, because the way things are going, they have a "Single Point of Failure" (SPOF) (one dev) and the future of this game far from decided.  
It'll probably at least be on hold for a couple more year, with barely any development.  
  
So my review is "don't buy", hold on for progress to ramp up.  
  
But in my experience, a lot of games who have some kind of boom during early life, and don't scale the development from there don't really accelerate their development, and end up dead on arrival, because they won't get much more money, and they won't get much more progress.  
The time to ramp up and get more developers, is past, I wish them good luck.

Edit: Also I want to mention that these problems are not new either, they've just become more and more apparent over the last two years since I bought the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157586349', 'num_games_owned': 244, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 2681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2401, 'last_played': 1699881424}
review:
(Deleted previous review to make a new one as I had already edited it quite a few times)

After a few long years of mostly silence and no game updates in part due to the aggravation of the russo-ukrainian war, the devs finally managed to push a new version, and it looks like they are also intent on pushing out very regular if small patches and bugfixes. As of writing this there have been 3 bugfixes pushed on top of the "big" update in I wanna say 5 days or something?

Sadly that update also saw a lot of feature removed, in order for the devs to be able to build from a fresh and stable base. They admitted to getting caught up in a feature creep and this is a very reasonable step to take to solve that issue. They have said they will reintroduce features slowly and ensure they are fully and working and most importantly fun and engaging before moving on to the next part.

So unfortunately in the current state of the game, there's not much to do and it feels like a barebones demo as opposed to the previous version, so keep that in mind and maybe hold off buying the game for now if that's a problem to you. However if you have money to spare and would like to support devs who kept hard at work as best they could despite their very unfortunate and dire condition, do buy the game. I think they deserve it for tring to see their project through in spite of what happened and there's really no other simillar game available out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997059201', 'num_games_owned': 283, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 564, 'last_played': 1698833760}
review:
I like the game, but it's way to hard to begin from the start, I've been doing a new game for 5 times now with the same result: No H2O.

At start, you get a small basic tutorial to create a station where you will have a refinery and production facility, after that you need some crew stuff and then you need to be as quick as possible to create a fuel generator.

All fun and games, but this is where things are getting weird, because you need a fair bit of copper for that, but close by there is almost no copper, so you either need to buy that (but you have only 2K Creds) or find it with the limited fuel you have.

You can buy fuel (H2O) at a station, but also there it is limited and very expensive, I ended up floating in space 3 times without fuel because I couldn't make it yet or the station didn't sell it anymore.

Hope this will be fixed in the future, because I really love the game, but hate to start all over again for the 5th time because of Fuel shortage.

Anyways, it's still a very awesome game, so I will still recommend it, (and maybe I am just doing it wrong and I suck then :p)

author: {'steamid': '76561197964009610', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 567, 'last_played': 1701302323}
review:
Previously positive: Reviewing from the current (unfortunate circumstances) state, if you don't mind an unfinished but playable sandbox with broad room for expansion (when and if normal development is able to resume) It's definitely worth the asking price. If you don't like alpha state early access games, I'd skip it until it's more fleshed out.

Update Nov 2023 and downgrade to Negative:

Developers have pushed a few updates that basically redesigned the game to be more simplistic, cutting half-working features with vague promises of continued work towards re-implementation at a later date. It really killed what made me give it a positive review in the first place. Sometimes developers can't deliver - at the end of the day, as a consumer, the reasons for failing are irrelevant. This developer group certainly has plenty of very real reasons for failing to deliver. They deserve a chance to continue to operate as a business, but I'd be hesitant in future financing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115425487', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2067, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2012, 'last_played': 1711206719}

author: {'steamid': '76561198011452928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1556, 'last_played': 1652891909}
review:
Save your money, stay away from that game.

I bought this game, two years ago and tried it out with some friends. The controls are unnecessary complicated, also interaction with another object. When you do the tutorial, you will already notice the bad game design, with overlapping messages and the controls will drive you mad.

Now two years later, there was an announcement by the developers that they will freeze the development because of war in Ukraine. I thought let’s give it a try what happened after two years. Nothing, it still the same unfinished game. Now the developers just made an excuse why not to progress anymore.

Look around for all the other magnificent space games out there but stay away from this one.
Thanks for reading.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993630200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 377, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1698748977}
review:
Despite having been in EA since 2014, Celestial Command has not so far achieved a meaningfully playable state and my confidence in its future development is low. The dev is releasing updates every now and then and much work is being done, so more optimistic people may see it more positively, but for me there just isn't enough game to it. In my opinion, it's mostly a tech demo right now.

What's more is that the developer seems to have long-term design plans that effectively invalidate much of the game's early promise, or at least dumb it down to the point where you might as well be playing anything else. See aerodynamic mode receiving developmental focus instead of orbital mechanics, full 3D movement getting the axe in favor of a return to 2D, plans for a single HP bar instead of individually destructible components, and increasingly game-y systems like a limit on the numbers of weapons mounted on a ship and having space-magic force field shields instead of armor.

The dev has his reasons for these things - his current concern is apparently with making the game conform to conventional sci-fi game expectations and to streamline it -, but his vision seems so basic and unambitious that I really don't see why you should be interested in this game.

I hope to be wrong, but would not recommend buying into it at present.

Edit: Big v0.9 update came out recently. Unfortunately, everything I wrote above still stands.

author: {'steamid': '76561198268768955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 1242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1673281623}
review:
This one can be a bit confusing to start with.  It seems to start you at the wrong end of things -- but there is a reason.  It starts you with building a station.  But to build you need materials which you need to buy or scavenge.  And to survive you need oxygen, food, and hydrogen which in the beginning you must also buy.  And to buy anything you need money for which you need to mine and sell ores.

However, the game gives you a head start with materials for building, which you need to use in order to have room for ores to mine.  Though one of the things you can build is storage right on your ship.  Or you can put the cargo containers on a station you build and put extra stuff there.

You may want to start without the orbital mechanics to get used to how these things work.  But ultimately the orbital mechanics is what the game is really about -- what makes the game unique.

review: This game is pathetic for how long it's been in development. Stay away. Very little communication and so few updates. author: {'steamid': '76561198192785151', 'num_games_owned': 254, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 5506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5506, 'last_played': 1588534698}
review:
First time i played it for 90h and had a lot of fun. Im also used to EA games, bugs, no tutorials and what. Its also very bare bones. At this state its definitely not something for most people. But thas not the reason for my negative review.

Its mainly because of how long the game has already been in development for (2014) and the frequency of each update. Its incredibly slow, more than 2 year since the last main branch and year ago was a experimental. 

Hard to recommend any game that moves at a snails pace. The devs aren't the best in communicating either, which doesn't help. All we get is empty promises and then silence.... until the pop up with some announcement.

TLDR : VERY slow development. Empty promises then silence. Unsure when the game will be completed or IF it ever will be before Star Citizen. Very high risk investment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004415983', 'num_games_owned': 245, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 9093, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8794, 'last_played': 1701005516}
review: Перевернул палец вверх - появились обновления. Попробовал новинку: понравилось, что убрали еду. Когда ищешь ледяные астероиды - не до еды... Дроны-ремонтникки и добытчики - одобряю. Понравились. Графика вроде бы лучше стала. ИИ пиратов получше - корабли уже бестолково не летают и не врезаются друг в друга и в астероиды. Пираты теперь могут преследовать, хотя я и прячусь за астероидами. Продолжаю изучать новую версию. Пока в начале не понял, почему на стартовом корабле нет солнечных панелей. Наверно и не нужно - энергию космоса впитываю... Еще раз: задумка игры хорошая, даже оригинальная. Жду положительных изменений. Если я правильно понял - новый программист в команде?

author: {'steamid': '76561198056242123', 'num_games_owned': 1038, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1615579024}
review:
Game in realistic physics is almost unplayable! I came here after Scott Manley video from 2018. And nothing chaged for 3 years, sadly. This mode has nice trick with grid. But relative scale of ship and station makes it really hard to perform docking. basically opposite sides of station has really different orbits.   Strangely, but simple mobile game "Space agency" was able to do it right! It also 2d and has unrealistic scale, even more than in this game, but orbital mechanics works far better. 

In this game you should use to many fuel to dock or approach gateway in realistic physics due to stations rotation.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985454926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1612488986}
review:
Clunky controls that make simple tasks a pain
Windows disappear and you have to restart the game to see them again
Cluttered GUI that feels super simplistic
Camera... what is up with these camera mechanics?
Trading is bugged, sell mode doesnt work. 1 click out of 5000 i will sell 10 units...
2D building system in a 3D world...
Snap to grid system is broken, mounting points fail often

Learning curve is super steep, the tutorial tells you bugger all and basically just throws you in the deep end.


I really want to like this game but these small bugs make it incredibly hard to enjoy, and im a big fan of space sims even if they are as challenging as this.

I'm going to lay down, I have a headache...

author: {'steamid': '76561198024992456', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1699382910}
review:
At best, this is a prototype; or a proof-of-concept. The software compiles… and that's it.  There are so many things wrong with it that it's not playable.  There is no game here, a developer's broken pipe dream and a few space toys for people to say "Spaceship go brrrrrrrrr!!" and that's it.

Save your time (and money)…… maybe come back when it's playable if that ever comes…

Premise of the game seems simple : Spaceship made of modules, you need items (&currency) to build/repair modules.  You need resources for your ship to move… and yet you'll be fighting with the interface at every moment.

It'll take you forever to figure out HOW to build a module.  Once you do, you'll wonder why the construction stopped mid-way  – seems like the software randomly turns "actively building" off even if you have plenty of resources and are in-range of "builders".  If you fancy fighting with a UI like you like driving your head through a brick wall, then by all means, this prototype is for you.

Managed to disable two enemy ships with my mining laser (since I can't build anything) only to have random "friendly" NPC ships constantly shoot me as they fly by and try to shoot the enemies… My ship is completely disabled now and through no fault of my own nor the enemy;  Don't have enough resources to replace the solar panels nor engines… because last time I tried, "allied" NPCs destroyed it trying to "kill" the dead enemy.  Garbage prototype is garbage!  Move along!

author: {'steamid': '76561198084572529', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 4908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4571, 'last_played': 1700947838}
review:
this game allowed me to create a 95% self sustaining battleship capable of traversing the galaxy and erasing any enemies stupid enough to oppose me. 

the animations for salvaging, mining, weapons fire and warp are excellent, the mechanics for flight whether orbital or resistance work well and the graphics for the "skybox" give the game an atmospheric immersive feel.

my only gripe is limited content, but it kept me entertained for 76 hours at point of review so only a minor gripe. due to the updates and hard work of the dev team there is always a reason to come back to this little gem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198301707679', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3929, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3526, 'last_played': 1709997111}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971504491', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1802, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1097, 'last_played': 1609206890}
review:
Im giving this game a thumbs up but only conditionally. 

 I just spent 15 minutes trying to get a cargo container to attach to my station and no matter what I do... It wont attach. Then I find my ship detached from the station despite both locks appearing "docked" etc. There are a lot of small annoying bugs and the tutorial doesn't teach you everything you need to know either. That said its quite a fun game and there is a lot of promise here.

review: This has been in early access for more than 6 years. With that in mind, the game feels really empty and bland. It has the potential, but it needs more. More enemies, more modules, more research. Not to mention the countless bugs and random artifacts popping up in the graphics. Hard pass.

author: {'steamid': '76561199091801067', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1672755180}
review: Really cool concept and nicely executed! the graphics are awesome (Even for my low-end computer!) and the gameplay, whilst a little grindy at the beginning, is full of interesting activities and things to discover. I'm 5 hours in and ready for 100 more!

author: {'steamid': '76561198032117048', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1441, 'last_played': 1699328449}
review:
I am [i]tentatively[/i] revising this to a recommendation on the basis that the game is indeed shaping up to be a physics-lite component-based 2D space simulator, a sort of two-dimensional peaceful Elite with occasional combat, something that has been sorely lacking in the world of sci-fi space simulators.  It's still too early to make judgements, but it shows substantial potential.  Once the illegal and immoral invasion of Ukraine by Russia ends, I hope that this game will shine.

My old review, which includes the above paragraph, follows:
[strike]I would actually recommend this game prior to its change in direction.  Originally, it was shaping up to be a physics-lite component-based 2D space simulator, a sort of two-dimensional peaceful Elite with occasional combat, something that has been sorely lacking in the world of sci-fi space simulators.  It was still a little early to make any judgements, but it showed substantial potential.  Unfortunately, it is changing into a relatively unremarkable physics-heavy 3D space simulator, vaguely akin to a combat- and mining-oriented Kerbal Space Program where you start in space and head down to the ground instead of the other way around.

It does have a few saving graces, and more than a few people will probably enjoy it, but I couldn't recommend it as a must-have to someone who doesn't know what they're getting into.[/strike]

Well, it seems like the developers agreed!  They have once again switched back to a planar solar system, exactly what I was hoping for.  If they can keep it up, this could turn into something amazing.  Development has been quite slow, especially thanks to Putin's fratricidal and genocidal campaign, so be careful and don't expect a miracle, but I'm cautiously optimistic again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076882360', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 567, 'last_played': 1698702140}
review:
UPDATE - 0.9 is finally and here and seems more like 0.1 given even the tutorial for orbital mode is so broken that you cant actually play that mode.

Aero mode has flight characteristics similar to wading through thick syrup.

Save your money - this is a bloated tech demo somehow achieving over 5gb of disk space despite really basic textures. 

Also the devs have a long track record of promising and promising and delivering years late with a buggy underwhelming mess.

This update took 4 years for them to make and I can't really say its actually improved. They made the physics so its total HP for a craft rather than module by module, thats the opposite of progress.

Meh/10


Original review:

This game is a cash grab abandonware and is essentially a case study of everything bad about early access.

I bought it years ago and very quickly encountered fundamental game breaking bugs. Forum posts the devs had responded to describing the same bugs were a year old at that point.

Since then I have seen the devs make promise after promise and fail to deliver anything at all.

They make grand claims and nothing gets released. They wait a few months then do the same again. Still nothing gets released. This has been going on for years now.

There has not been a single update since I bought it.

The price for what you get is extortionate. The devs by all evidence are just milking the POC demo for cash and do not appear to be intending to release anything any time soon.

Do not buy. There are far cheaper ways to experience disappointment.

This is exactly the type of development studio that gives early access a terrible name.

0/10, do not want to fall victim to cashgrab early access scam again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090688892', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1598704521}
review:
I played way more than two hours but Steam sometimes underestimate the play time.

So  this game is basically everything I want, it’s an incredible technical challenge, I love the setting (space, basically) but I really can’t recommend it. The devs add very nice features but here we are in 2020 and the game still sucks.

They should really focus on the core mechanics and stop adding features. Building the ship sucks when it should be the fun and rewarding part. The UX is hyper mega clunky. I see no future for this game if they keep in that direction. It is really sad because they have very good ideas.

review: I just love the feel of the game, flying or should I say falling through space trying not to smash into things all the while trying to build an incredible space empire, what's not to love. The idea of playing online with other players and getting into combat for territory sounds like a blast as well. It would be neet to have at least one station in each star system that serves as a meeting place for all players to dock at and enter the station. Inside the station would be a first person perspective kind of thing where you can see the planet you are obiting outside the window.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040773944', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 17061, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17061, 'last_played': 1600677525}
review:
Honestly, this'll be my second time writing a review for this game - the first one was a meaningful one, but it centered on an issue that can be largely ignored if you play properly... however, I've had to revise my opinion of this game drastically - don't get me wrong, the game's graphics are decent enough for a game made in Unity (of which I truly dislike since it seems to be riddled with issues, glitches and bugs)... in fact I'd want to recommend it to players, but after 250+ hrs on the game (of which at least 3 separate attempts to play properly!), I still can't recommend the game to anyone simply because there are weird bugs/glitches that *don't* seem related to Unity, but specifically to the game code/mechanics itself!

so where do my gripes with the game start....?

issue #1 - when designing and planning ships and stations, one often makes mistakes of placement or orientation of objects being built, but if you make a slight misalignment, the object being place doesn't always get attached to the correct attachment point...

in fact, there seems to be some priority connections set up in the game's mechanics, as such you could be wanting to place, say an engine by the command center, but if there's a fuel tank nearby, the game *AUTOMATICALLY* attaches the engine to the fuel tank, disregarding actual bounding box issues (thus leading to say the engine being in the middle of the command center - at this point, do *not* attempt to save/reload the game until after you've removed the stacked objects, it'll go bang and destroy the ship in question when reloaded)

with the above paragraph mentioned, a player should be aware that if there's any slight misalignment between two separated objects (regardless of how close/far apart they are), objects can and will jump between themselves when the player attempts to use the "attach" feature to connect - this wouldn't be so bad, but 90% of the time, the *larger* object will jump/shift alignment to the smaller one, which usually results in one or more objects suddenly exploding (and thus cascades through physics to destroy the rest of the ship by close proximity collisions) [this actually happened to one of my large-scale stations (mass was listed around 7.4 million), *entire* station jumped to align to the one object i had selected 'attach' to! - needless to say, had to reload the game from prior)

issue #2 - occasionally, you'll get messages about ships getting destroyed in the *starting* planetary orbit, this is *intentional*... what the developers haven't told players is that the ally ships floating around the starting planetary system actually *explode* randomly - which can usually be attributed to the fact those ally ships *usually* have 'no-clipping/no-collision' status set to 'on' for them, that gets randomly turned off when loading from a save (this other instance of where the 'no-clipping/no-collision' status getting turned off is when accepting 'cargo retrieval' missions)

in the last attempt at playing this game, i unintentionally found a warp gate missing from its location (not to mention the loss of a ship that was parked nearby) - why did that happen? because a stupid ally hauler ship had exploded (randomly once again!) in the middle of a cluster of asteroids, of which quite a few were sent towards my spare ship and the warp gate.  incidentally, the destruction of the warp gate by the asteroids generates an internal error because the paired warp gate no longer works (lol)

issue #3 - occasionally with large-scale ships/stations (~500000+), parts will suddenly disconnect when loading the save game, and if they're slightly misaligned, issue #1 will apply quite quickly

thus In closing, apparently at the time of writing this second review, the developers were making the transition from 2D to 3D object placement, plus combat and even the introduction of planetary surfaces - but if the fundamental issues mentioned above aren't patched/fixed/reviewed etc first, then there is absolutely no reason to recommend this game to anyone afterwards (in fact, i had tried the released preview version and found that it caused even more problems with controls and ship/station designs!)

i should add, in related matters - the developers have seen fit to remove specific features of the game such as:

- turrets now allow shooting through the ship itself (to avoid friendly fire), but limited the actual range of motion to leave a very large vulnerability above the turret - basically assume conventional main guns from a battleship mounted on a spaceship for *all* weapons (this despite some weapons having a obvious 360 circular coverage)

- the developers have stated very clearly that they intend to eliminate any and all possible methods of duplicating resources within the next couple of patches; this includes the removal of sandbox mode, that player are no longer able to capture parts from enemy ships, anything that could be attached to a ship has to be salvaged into parts first and then produced at a components factory (and if you don't have the research done at the time, tough luck, that nice energy laser you managed to chip off the enemy ship has to be melted down and you *can't* rebuild it!)

if the developers truly intend to remove methods of resource duplication, or to limit the sources of possible resources, then i *sincerely* suggest they eliminate the production of debris - in this regard, it would mean as soon as an object's HP has been reduced to 0, it explodes, destroys the surrounding objects as well, and then leaves *nothing* behind, no debris etc - if an object gets separated from the original ship, it should be removed straight away, again, no debris remains for the player to salvage.  in this way, the developers can force players to rely on getting resources through mining or hopefully earning enough credits to buy from ally stations *only*

In the interest of making the game more tedious to play, the developers should:

- remove the player's ability to move objects within a stations sphere of influence
- player can only move objects from one attachment point on a given ship to another attachment point on the *same* ship (if you want to move from one ship to another, then first you have to salvage into raw materials, then fabricate at a factory, before finally constructing at a player-owned shipyard)
- this can only happen at a player-owned station

author: {'steamid': '76561198009060155', 'num_games_owned': 183, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 4347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1964, 'last_played': 1701462880}
review:
It's a fun little near-future Space Building and Trading (Sim?) Game.  Some things could be better, but they got the core game play just right.  It's a small dev team, but they listen.

It uniquely gives the user a choice between orbital (no friction, orbital mechanics like Kerbals) or aerodynamic (friction, move in a linear direction like Escape Velocity)

The Fun:
- Docking (well, I think it's fun...and even more fun in orbital space)
- Combat is pretty good, though I'm not an authority on it.
- Trading or mining-and-selling works pretty well.
- Managing consumables on the ship to keep the crew alive.
- Building your own ships is pretty boss, and fairly intuitive.

The Not-So-Fun:
- The tutorial leaves a little bit to be desired, but it's EA and I'm sure what's there is a placeholder.
- Slow development (but it's worth the wait, and understandable with the small dev team)
- The UI is a little sparse.  I'd like to see my hold capacity as a constant UI element
- Minor bugs here and there
- Some parts just don't fit well and there's kinda 2-3 "sizes" of things without an exact idea of what goes together.

Overall, I think there's nothing wrong enough with this game to warrant avoiding it and there's enough good (and constantly getting better) that I'd recommend it, even over most of the other build-your-own-ship games.  

Lastly, I realize in writing this, that the game gets better with time.  Not only as the devs make it, but as you play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995380276', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1147, 'last_played': 1636929113}
review:
This is a promising little game.  They look to be on the right development path, and the game is taking shape nicely albeit at times slowly as they refactor and extend.

Currently difficult to control and build and various other minor inconveniences as the UI develops along with the game features.

It feels a little like an arcade game possibly because of the graphics and the view, but it is quite the hard core space orbital & building sim. You manage food, oxygen for your crew and fuel for your engines, trying to burn as little as possible as you navigate among and mine the asteroids trying to turn a profit.

Get to grips with orbital mechanics when you want to catch up to a station or other POI. A little example:

Everything is moving in an orbit, and if you are not really close to it, you have to apply thrust in the wrong (opposite) direction because low orbits are faster than higher orbits. So you make your orbit lower by aiming backwards (retrograde) and slowing down. Now you are orbiting the planet faster, and can catch up to your target. You could also do the opposite. Thrust forward (prograde) and your orbit goes higher on the opposite side of the planet, and now, by thrusting forwards, speeding up a bit, you are orbiting slower and your target catches up to you.

Just a little example of the hidden complexities in this simple looking little game.

They have also done something very important. Right from the beginning multiplayer and networking is in the game. How many games are great and wonderful games but they are single player only and what a battle to get multiplayer added.

Here's hoping they achieve what they are aiming at. I think it has a good chance, and if the concept and idea appeals to you, support them for the price of a good pizza or two and lets see how they go.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110054641', 'num_games_owned': 217, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 1617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 526, 'last_played': 1699204068}
review:
As of 12/4/23 I can't recommend this game anymore... The features promised are either half baked or shit at best, there's no better way to say it. Some features were even removed. (Friendly stations for instance, i haven't found one YET) its all based on 'encounters' now. Which I find to be trivial at best, and boring at worst. Building has also been gutted, crew are now non existent, which was one fun mechanic to manage. Fuel is also completely mute, as you can build a capital ship, which has NO fuel consumption. And attach your mining ship to it, drive by any asteroid, and switch to said mining ship. So the only challenge left is combat, right? Holy shit its bad. AI might as well be braindead, unless you get in a SPECIFIC range of them, to 'detect' you. There's also a bad problem of the 2D plain becoming 3D for AI, and your turrets will not be able to shoot a target, due to it being out of that 2D space by a small portion.

In total, for two years in development, it feels just like EA's battlefield 2042, regressed in every way, shape, and form. 

Also.. I know they literally were in the crossfire of a war, but that doesn't excuse laziness. If the game wasn't ready, tell us. Sure some would be pissed, but radio silence, just to come back to this mess, is not the way to go.

Devs, wish you luck in the future, but christ almighty... This was a horrible way to come back. I however.. Am done giving this game a chance.

3/10



UPDATE: As of 7/11/23 there is no update in general. I sadly can not recommend this game at all any longer. The devs are currently either abandoning the project completely, or forced to stop it essentially due to the ongoing conflict in Ukraine, as it has been complete radio silence since Nov of 2022. A massive shame too, was looking forward to the update, and some of the bugfixes promised.



UPDATE: As of 11/30/20 the bug listed below is still happening, one of the developers has since came out addressing the issue, so we'll have to see if it's fixed soon.


Honestly, it's brutally hard to recommend this game at the current moment. 

In my 8 hours (Most of it done recently, after I came back to the game.) I've encountered 'Internal Error' so many times, warping and moving around... That for the first time ever, I actually Alt F4'd......

It completely breaks the experience, as I can't leave the starter system without risk of it breaking completely. Requiring me to find an auto-save which was before I made the jump. Not to mention most ores (Copper, Niobium, and Titanium) REQUIRE you to leave your starter system. (To build lasers, your science module for the space station. Etc.)

Until this issue is patched, or fixed. I absolutely can't recommend this game to anyone, outside of playing Sandbox mode constantly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198160225055', 'num_games_owned': 137, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1579101673}
review:
It really has big potential, but after playing it for 90 minutes, I was still at square one, I knew how the game worked, but it just isn't smart. If i connect a ship with cargo to my own station for example, I still need cargo on the station to process it there. Same with power. And when I wanted to warp to get prefabs for my station, I just got an error and coudn't teleport. After choosing another warp gate, I could warp, but had to pay 150 credits per prefab. I baught 10 cause thats what I need to store Iron and Cobalt. After that, I realised i didn't have power either, even tho my ship was connected. No problem, I will just remove my solar pannel, deconstruct it and reattach it to the station. After that, I still needed crew so i transfered my pilot. Too bad, u need an engineer. At this point i only had 380 credits wich is not enough to warp, and since there were no npc space stations near my starter planet, i was stuck.

4/10 for potential. 
Woudn't recommend

developer_response: Да, это действительно так, мы осознаем что мы слишком переусложнили многие аспекты игры и работаем над тем чтобы все было намного понятнее и очевиднее. Должно быть намного лучше в следующей версии 0.9.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070036358', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1708693548}
review:
As a game it lacks gameplay; as a sandbox it lacks sand physics.

Disclaimer: I played KSP. A lot.

So the issue I have with CC in it's current state is, it's a sandbox where you build and fly ships in space, and [b]flying sucks[/b]. It has (a simplified) orbital movement mechanic, but provided almost no tools for trajectory planning; orbital transfer for interception (getting into specific position in target orbit) is mostly done by eyeballing; and there's a very strong bias in the game that "orbit" is a circle.

Nothing to see here for a space nerd.

The game is still in early access and I hope it will improve. I wouldn't expect major changes on "space simulation" part; but with NPC in orbit mode (there are none atm) and more things to do it may still become an ok game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006889030', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1121, 'last_played': 1624566781}
review:
Petit jeu prometteur sur l'espace. Les annonces des prochaines mises à jours me rendent impatient.
On peut construire nos vaisseaux, que ça soit des vaisseaux de transport, de minage d’extraction de gaz ou d’exploration (recherche)…. Sans oublier les combats ! Le jeu est actuellement en développement (Alpha) et à vrai dire j’ai juste tester en mode bac à sable je suis dans l’attente de la maj 0.9 avant de pouvoir faire une vraie partie. Mais tous ce que j’ai vu en mode bac à sable donne envie de voir ce jeu se finir.
Les développeurs ont un discord où ils sont très présents et répondre assez rapidement aux questions, la communauté semble aussi assez sérieuse et sais répondre correctement même si on raconte des âneries.
Pour ma part je rajouterais qu’il n’y a pas de mauvais jugement quand on souhaite partager/proposer ou poser une question en anglais et que c’est pas notre langue maternelle ou qu’on a une mauvaise maitrise de la langue.
Je tenais à préciser ce point car il est souvent très décourageant de soutenir un projet (jeu) quand une communauté est toxique sur la langue du jeu.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983542504', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 1264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1699264137}
review: Многого сказать не могу, НО игра затягивает , скрывать не буду есть недостатки ( например игра требует доработки экономического баланса, интеллекта НПС и перестройки ВАРП ворот в плане радиуса зон для перемещаемых объектов ) , но  тем не менее достаточно интересна и порой сильно затягивает. Конечно временами сильно не хватает русского языка ( перевод частичный от сообщества игроков , есть в настройках игры ), также не помешало бы более продуманное обучение ( так сказать "продвинутый Курс Молодого Бойца" ) . В остальном все очень даже не плохо , с хорошим заделом на будущее. Радует и тот факт что разработчики игру не бросают , постоянно улучшают и добавляют что-то новенькое. Так что всем любителям жанра рекомендуется иметь в своей коллекции.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990935065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 4519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3735, 'last_played': 1708986384}
review:
I have owned this title for awhile now and have not down a review due to the game was in still in development and I wanted to see the direction it was headed in.  From the top down orbital game to where stands now it really impressive and it seems they are making good decisions on the way they want there game to be.  I would Highly recommend to any one who asks. 

You start with a choice of playing in a realistic Space sim or one that is more "Star Wars" style of flying. The star wars style means you have less to worry about and is a great way to get the feel for the game.  From there you start with a simple ship and instructions on building your first base and after that it's up to you, Mine, attack drones, Trade at space stations , travel to other planets , Keep building your fleet of ships. 

The Graphics, Controls, sounds are all really good in this game, The only downside is this game is in development so alot of the depth isn't there , YET . But My feeling is it's coming and we are looking forward to it

review:
Sa n'est pas le jeu de l'année, innoubliable d'on on ne peut se passer mais comme jeu de pose de temps en temps il passe bien. Les mise à jour se font toujours mais elle ne sont pas fréquente. 
C'est un jeu en semi 3D-2D Et le contenue n'est pas énorme.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008057658', 'num_games_owned': 1167, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 918, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1574409095}
review:
I have to say  i picked up this game way back when it first went into EA ... I ended up refunding for various reasons but it really boiled down to my own money issues and my need to be particular about what i spent. But after over a year the changes and development are amazing, have come a long way, and stayed true to the direction of the game from initial launch. I recently no longer have money issues and decided after reading reviews and watching recent vids i would give it another shot especially since The dev has been a great example of how to do an indie game and do it right!! Im very happy i came back to this game and cant wait to see where it goes! 
It is def a chill game and can take a little to figure out as the tutorial stuff doesnt really hit on mechanics or direction past basics. but again still early. 
Graphics are pretty good , gameplay once you have it figured out is great and does grab me and keeps me trying to get things built. I still dont quiet get some of the station mechanics but ill figure them out. I highly recommend if you enjoy chill, space, mining, combat, and supporting indie devs then its a must buy PLUS its not a lot for what ya get and the support you are giving, plus a great game to stream and listen to music and chat with viewers while you figure out how not to die :) 

overall id say 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197987838834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 15098, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8938, 'last_played': 1685784043}
review:
When I started playing this, it was pretty much barebones, the devs wrote in bad broken english and the game took alot of resources, but i've been playing this intermittently now since it came out and I must say things have changed.

The devs write in pretty good coherent english (except for missing out on "an, a, of" occasionally) in the patch notes, the game is very much playable and presents it's own challanges whatever you choose to do, it gets slow but steady and big updates, I enjoy this game and it's development very much, it's like seeing a baby grow into a functioning person.

All in all, it's a nice game to waste some hours on when you're inbetween things, I keep coming back to it and have never uninstalled it.

review: I have owned this game for about 4 years now. I download it, try it out and I end up getting bored with it after about half an hour. author: {'steamid': '76561198053510721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1252, 'last_played': 1570736254}
review:
Игра не стоит даже этих денег. Она неплохая, не о абсолютно пустая,  искать только ещё  сумасшедшего для игры в мультиплеер и всё. Миссии глупые и одинаковые. 
Да красивый космос и тд., Но  заниматься там нечем обсалютно.  Глупый им, который в других системах расшибается о станции или просто замирает около них. Игра на 30 минут, ровно столько нужно, чтобы во всем разобраться. Дальше можно деинсталировать. Хорошая задумка, но на этом всё.  Игра по моим ощущениям, так и осталась задумкой. Если хотите попробовать, найдите сломанную копию, ничего не потеряете

author: {'steamid': '76561198013771926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1567263115}
review:
Bon, inutile de le cacher: la prise en main est complexe! Autant par le maniement des vaisseaux que par "Bon. Et je commence par où, je fais quoi?". Le jeu demande un petit effort d'adaptation. On tâtonne, on se plante, on oublie des composants, on recommence, et on progresse: la frustration fait vite place au plaisir de réussir l'amarrage parfait, ou d'avoir construit son premier vaisseau autonome, voire même sa première station spatiale. faut juste s'accrocher, pas se décourager, et le plaisir de jeu est au rendez-vous, garanti!
Question bugs, pas de plantage, pas de défauts notoires, le jeu tourne impeccable, c'est fluide, et c'est beau, pour les amateurs d'environnements spatiaux.
En bref, si vous n'êtes pas découragé par le fait qu'il va falloir apprendre par vous-même (le tuto étant très succinct, et plutôt vague), vous pouvez acheter sans problème. 6 heures de jeu pour moi, après de nombreuses erreurs de conception dans la construction, j'ai désormais une base orbitale quasiment autonome, bien calée sur son orbite, un vaisseau minier et un petit "chasseur".

author: {'steamid': '76561197977902981', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1698692973}
review:
It's been 5 years and this is still unplayably clunky, at this point you're just paying for someones game development hobby. The rate of progress is so ridiculously slow that it seems inevitable that this will be abandoned before it's even half-way to being an actual game.

EDIT: I'm going to update this review to say that the developer is still actively taking feedback on issues so I'll likely come back and try this again in the future. For now I'd still stand by my review that in the current state it's not very playable.
developer_response:
Complex projects requires large amount of time to develop. Development is super active and fast. Just check our development blog to see how many and significant features and improvements we adding with each update.

https://steamcommunity.com/app/330460/allnews/

Also you may compare our first trailer with the most recent one:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ONdIjvBFgsk

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rtM3JggWZ70

The difference is huge.

However, we understand why you are made such conclusion. This is due lack of game play goals and smooth tech progression. Right now we are working on the next big update which should improve these aspects with additional of a lot of new content to research and unlock, as result the game should be much more enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011765981', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2933, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1704060772}
review: Also ich will fair bleiben - nach einer Stunde spielen schon ein Review? Daher werde ich mein Review später gern ergänzen/ändern. Aber was mich an dem Spiel jetzt schon stört, ist die unnötig komplexe Steuerung. Und dabei ist die Geschichte ja nicht mal dreidimensional: alle Objekte bewegen sich auf einer Ebene. Aber warum dann manuell Andocken? Warum nicht einfach ein Schiff direkt zur Station fliegen und andocken lassen? Ich glaube das Spiel hat genügend Potential, da muss man die Steuerungselemente doch nicht unnötig aufblasen? Ich werds jetzt weiter ausgiebig spielen, weil mir die Produktions/Handelsketten sicherlich Spaß machen werden. Aber die Steuerung - wird mich nerven.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005262763', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1198, 'last_played': 1598320921}
review: This game used to work very well.  I don't know what happened during all the recent updates, but in multiplayer there are position desyncs.  This is just unplayable in multiplayer right now, and that's very disappointing.
developer_response:
Sad to know that you are disappointed, unfortunately multiplayer feature is not fully ready yet and quite unstable at this moment. This is quite a complex task.

For now multiplayer is good mostly for ship construction and combat in sandbox mode.

There is a message in-game which said that survival game mode for multiplayer is not ready yet, however we are working on it and it will be done once we be sure that everything works as intended in single-player (otherwise multiplayer will be unusable).

For now you may try sandbox mode and let us know if something works wrong.

Discord chat:
https://discordapp.com/invite/celestialcommand

author: {'steamid': '76561197997366760', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 924, 'last_played': 1698609348}
review:
Leider erscheinen Updates extrem selten und enthalten keine nennenswerten Verbesserungen.

Das Gameplay ändert sich bis zum Lategame kaum und einfache Tätigkeiten wie Resourcen grinden begleitet einen bis zum Schluss.
Es gibt keine Technologien auf die man hin arbeiten möchte oder die eine tatsächliche Verbesserung bieten.
Autominer für stationäre Asteroiden wären bereits eine willkommene Technologie.
Leider gab es seit vielen Jahren keine Updates, die wirklich neuen Content eingebaut hätten, der das Spielgefühl verändert.
developer_response:
In order to avoid bug with duplication of everything, just load a save file from main menu (not from existed world). It should solve this issue in most cases.

Also since version 0.892 loading from existed world also should work without issues.

https://steamcommunity.com/games/CelestialCommand/announcements/detail/2538260142531902635

With warp gates situation is a bit more complex, this is turned out a complex bugs, however we improved some systems related to this and after last update situation can be better.

Let us know if you will encounter these bugs again.

Discord chat:
https://discordapp.com/invite/celestialcommand

author: {'steamid': '76561198121538130', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1649261982}
review:
Where to start?

Game is hard to get your head around at first, but if you continue to push yourself it's a good feeling when you accomplish something 

It's still EA but the updates that has come out recently has made the game so worth the price. 

I've been wanting this game for quite a few years but held off due to the reviews , but with recent updates I just had to pick it up. 

Pros:
- Space
- Ship building / Station building
- Trading 
- Engaging and fun combat
- Nice research system

And the best part is the developers are active on Discord where they or other community members will answer any questions asked :)

Well done!
