author: {'steamid': '76561197993788575', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1563499849}
review:
Seemed quite interesting, a 2d game with more realistic physics than "space is filled with water", and a strategy game that isn't Kerbal levels of frustration to manuver orbits? Sign me up!

5 years of early access, and this is it? Hard Pass.

The tutorial and in game tips assume you already know how to play the game, as they say "move here" and "build this" and "dock here" with no idea how to actually do these things. Accidentally bump a satellite into a non-circular orbit? You are apparently screwed. Tear it up and start over.

Perhaps if there was a demo that allowed for more than an hour or two of gameplay I could learn how to get past these frustrating parts before the steam refund period is up.

Also, Patreon begging, really? I know game development costs money, but it sounds like a good way to get people into "sunk costs fallacy" land for a game that may never be "finished".

author: {'steamid': '76561198048013098', 'num_games_owned': 320, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 448, 'last_played': 1590963393}
review:
TL;DR Unless you are looking for a long term investment in a game that has the potential to be good, take a pass on this one.

This game has a lot of potential but it is not there yet. The game is full of bugs and/or unfinished features that combine to make this game a pain to play. Both of the flight physics settings feel broken. 

You can change the setting betting aerodynamic flight in space (think Elite Danger or EVE) and orbital physics (think KSP). On orbital mechanics mode, the orbital period is extremely fast. This leads to minor differences in orbital trajectories very quickly becoming huge differences in speed leading to panic mode while chasing a docking port or orbiting an asteroid burning fuel just trying to stay in mining range. Aerodynamic flight mode adds resistance so you have to fly under power the entire time causing you to burn so much fuel that if you want to go any long distances, a third to half your ship needs to be fuel tanks (you can turn down the fuel burn rate in the menu if you don't mind feeling like you are cheating).

The ship building mechanics are alright. The ship board building modules are pretty handy and work well however their range is so limited that you have to have several of them on any ship that has a decent size to it (the basic starter ship would need 2 or 3 just to be able to cover it's own area). On the flip side, if you try to use the station shipyards, the are unreliable at best. The majority of the time you are trying to buy modules and fit them to your ship, it will charge you for the module but won't build it or when you move the module, it won't move. At other times, it disconnects various modules by random attachment points some of which you won't notice until you leave the shipyard and are promptly sent into an uncontrollable spiral until you give up and alt + f4. Compounding this issue is that there are no attachment or docking ports inside the hanger (at least none that I've found). This means that on orbital physics mode, you have a very limited time in which you can move modules on you ship before you need to correct its position. If you move a thruster and then float out of the shipyards range, you're stuck.

All of these combines with a few issues in other areas like, other ships don't have collisions boxes, solar panels not charging saying blocked by [insert whatever here] when they are not blocked by anything, and the general lack of feeling like the big empty thing that space is (at least in the starting area as the warp gates appear not to work or at least my simple brain couldn't figure it out) means that I have to recommend no on this game as of writing this comment. I'm sure that with time this game will become fantastic but, unless you are willing to put money into a game that has a long way to go, take a pass on this one. If you don't mind tinkering in a sandbox while waiting for something that has the potential to be great, then this is the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030934087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 558, 'last_played': 1563586123}
review: Interesting concept but to call it a buggy mess would be kind. Expect to spend considerable time in endless frustration just rebuilding your ships from scratch just to make sure it holds together, and hope that you don't lose all your crew in the process. The game play is also highly limited as there are little no support for scaling up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042495039', 'num_games_owned': 265, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1563010772}
review:
Игра еще сыровата. Нет неписей(читать как любых активностей кроме смотрения в монитор) в орбитальном режиме. В атмосферном режиме получаем традиционный жидкий вакуум, и игру в духе Osmos(собери маленькие кусочки чтобы получить материалы и стать сильнее)

Как только допилят нормальный геймплей к орбитальному режиму игра преобразится.

PS После ответа разработчиков и переспав с мыслями меняю статус обзора. Действительно игра в жидком вакууме может иметь своих фанатов. Игра в любом случае имеет отличный потенциал и живую разработку(которая не так часто встречается в наши дни).
PPS Сделал возврат, но игру оставил в списке желаемого. Буду и дальше следить за игрой. Верю в то, что когда допилят орбитальный режим возьму опять и уже навсегда.
developer_response:
Жидкий вакуум это не плохо, он есть во многих космических играх что не мешает им быть интересными : ) Кроме того он важен для различных игровых элементов.

Но да, NPC в орбитальным режим добавим когда убедимся что они там будут нормально работать.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023046509', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 3919, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1315, 'last_played': 1705006171}
review:
When I bought this game I made a long term investment. I've probably had the game for a year now and as you can see from my hours played that it has not gripped me.....This I expected  when i bought the game. Why I invested ..... because I saw the dream and potential of what this game could be.... Whats exciting is that slowly the dream is becoming a reality.....It is my deepest hope that more people see the dream.

I personally find the game mechanics becoming more intuitive with every update. The depth growing into an abyss drawing me in to explore more. Right now you should be clicking on sandbox when you start a new game to truly experience the  options. If not in sandbox there is a real grind with no motivation..... And here we get to the really exiting part..... the "goals"..."story"....."lore".... I cant wait to see the creativity that will flow into such rich and fertile ground that has been created by the developers
developer_response: Thanks you very much for you review, it is very important to us! We are very glad to know that you like how development is going. We have a great plans for development and going to make it even better! : )

author: {'steamid': '76561198091698832', 'num_games_owned': 454, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1707446936}
review:
Is the game worth $20 bucks? Yes. 

Is the game complete? No. 

Does it grab your attention where you have to play just one more minute? No. 

So why the positive review? 

The devs. Plain and simple. 

They are honest. I am one of the idiots that purchased Kinetic Void.  It was one of the first, or the very first early access game for steam. It gained a good following only to be abandoned. The game sucks now in it’s unfinished state. Many people now own a giant pile of crap with that game. They were not honest, they kept giving excuses, then poof, they disappeared. 

So, Kinetic Void was a cash grab? No. They ran out of money, got bored with production and bailed. 

What does That game have to do with Celestial Command? 

Funding. And that is it.  Celestial Command (CC) has admitted that they are low on funds. Without them, the devs can’t eat. If they can’t eat, they have to take time away from development to get jobs or scout for funding, and that takes away from the game. They are fighting tooth and nail to keep production of the game going at a good pace. 

So, why should I get this game if it might go the way of abandonment? 

Because I honestly think it won’t. You can support the devs if you wish by throwing them some change every month to help them out. patreon.com/celestialcommand

So you want me to pay for the game and continue to pay them more each month?!

You ask a lot of questions. But, no. Only if you believe in this game. I am starting too. I purchased this game soon after it was green lit almost five years ago.  It really was bare bones then, and after a few dev overhauls and many updates, it really is starting to come around. They just released 0.89, and it is impressive! Also, as of 4/2/20, they announced that the game is going 3d! Not just top down anymore. This game keeps getting better and better with every update. 

Yeah I tend to get bored after some time playing it… but it is much much better than what it was in the past. 

I have no doubt this game will grab my attention with a few more updates and some more polish and content. I can easily see myself calling in sick for work because I didn't sleep at all because I was playing this game. It’s just not there, yet. 

These guys are the true definition of an indie development team. They don’t have million dollar budgets and for some reason I can picture them sitting around eating noodles and other crap for dinner just so they can continue development, because they believe in this project. 

And I believe they can do it. If I could afford it, I would in a heart beat help them with patreon. However, as a single dad to a teenage girl, that is out of the question for now. But I am following it closely now. They have opened my eyes.

To the devs, you guys keep doing what you are doing. I love your honestly and your passion. You have a fan for life, just because of that.
developer_response: Thanks you very much for your review! It is really important for us and provides us a huge motivation. Thanks for believing in the project, we will make it great! : )

author: {'steamid': '76561198041805174', 'num_games_owned': 95, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2802, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 906, 'last_played': 1646734913}
review:
I don't write many reviews, but this one deserves it.

First off, when i bought this, i hated it....

Now a year later, i love it. yes it's not easy, you will start over a few times at start, even more so if you skip the tutorial, but it's worth learning. 

The game is by no means complete, infact i'd say early Beta at best, but it's fun, and you have a sense of purpose. It's not for everyone, for sure, but if you like sandbox building games, that require work, this is a good bet. It has a Sandbox mode, which is good for learning, but i suggest ignoring it for normal play, it takes the fun out of it if you don't have to mine, research, or build parts.


This is not a shoot'em up, far from it, yes it has weapons, but it's more a time waster game, to relax too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146307597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1562259360}
review:
This game sucks there is no explanation of controls no help with game play just here you are go f up tried to trade kept telling me to select a cargo bay tried to sell yep told me to select a cargo bay select a cargo bay no options to trade or sell. clicking and dragging did do something it deleted my items and gave me nothing. clicking on items and then on the trash can asked if you want to delete it but trading got rid of that silly question. wish I payed more attention and got my money back when I could.

Update 7/4/19
Just read the reply to my review. I was excited that the developers listened to some of the concerns. Then I reinstalled the game and saw that there was a tutorial great loved it some help.... Nope it starts out zoomed all the way out no instructions on how to zoom in but they want you to deploy a solar panel on the hull. I cant even see the ship just a pulsing yellow ring. No instructions on game controls no information on game interface nothing useful. Next only after fumbling with buttons and commands I was able to zoom in and deploy the solar panel they now want you to fly to the space station to refuel again NO control information NO game interface information nothing other then a pulsing yellow circle mine was on a planet so again after pushing buttons and guessing I blew up apparently you cant land on planets and the yellow pulsing ring was for a station on the other side. I turned it off and uninstalled again. Advice to developers try to think like a small child that has no idea what to do and design the tutorial around that. Try starting with moving. And to update my first reviews the game does not suck just trying to play it.
developer_response:
Indeed, previously the game had terrible issues with usability of crafting, trading and no explanation how to getting started.

We realize that and today we released a huge update which greatly improves almost every aspect of the game, including much better trading system and hints about gameplay during initial phase of the game.

https://steamcommunity.com/gid/103582791436739024/announcements/detail/1594753310292589821

Please take a look on the new update if you wish, it should be much better than before.

author: {'steamid': '76561198303413820', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 17250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4196, 'last_played': 1698783732}
review:
Pros:
-Relatively beginner-friendly
-Space
-You have complete freedom in what to do
-Multiplayer works already
-Orbital and Aerodynamic mode (you see orbital in the video)
-Unbelievably responsive devs - they literally answer any question and add all suggestions to to-do list
-Surprisingly low memory usage (for host)

Cons:
-Bugs(devs fixing though)
-Client dies in multiplayer while host sits very low on ram usage
-Somewhat slow development
-Some players may find gameplay boring

Conclusion:
This game is definitely worth its money, and its only getting better with time. 
9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198108466761', 'num_games_owned': 500, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 1577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1628278788}
review:
Brilliant and fun game for those into space building games with Newtonian physics although you can also play with more arcade physics if you wish.  Definately not a game for the impatient or those looking for a fast paced arcade shooter but if you want a slow paced, realistic space game then this is the game for you!

The game really opens up when you work out the basics such as researching and ship building and then vastly opens up when you research the warp drive and discover that every one of those stars on the map connected by gates actually has multiple planets and moons to explore!

8 hours in and i feel like ive just scratched the surface of this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197985725065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1219, 'last_played': 1558248437}

author: {'steamid': '76561198269607390', 'num_games_owned': 177, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1683622874}

author: {'steamid': '76561198268193917', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 152, 'playtime_forever': 5971, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1247, 'last_played': 1705009841}
review:
I love this game. With proper tweaking and added content this could be a well paced rouge-lite space sim. Comparable to a blend of KSP and SPAZ.

So far I put in 20 hours till i found the boundrys of the game. Which is limited to Space ship parts, missions and logistics. Its an Alpha, remind everyone this only means the first "playable" state. 

The graphics are nice and clean, backdrops are stunning, practicality is an actual thing.
The combat is pretty neat, you need to think about your approach and menuevers before attacking, or mining for that matter. The cannons will shift your position which if powerful enough can change your orbit.
You will mess around for some time, not so much in a state of limbo. The game itself is fairly self-explanitory and easy to figure out. 

 Logistics being the least prominent as there really is not much to speak of right now, hopefully they will add a myriad of fleet controls and AI to help sing your space opera.
 With it being early access there are not many missions, we got our basic stuff. Deliver this blow that up, harvest that.
 Although they have a decent selection of parts and you can certainly spend many hours fiddling with what they have here. 
Then of course if your going for a more extreme experience, try their advertised "Realistic Orbital Mechanics". You will be at it for quite some time, and it will be peaceful yet challenging.

There are a number of things either bugged or not implemented in this game right now, but it does not ruin the experience of a space sim and its not game breaking. Suprisingly stable actually.
Celestial Command has had a difficult and slow development. The devs have reached out to the community through Patreon and other avenues for financial assistance and support in other ways, but who am i to judge? So long as development continues and the product gets finished, then their methods don't need to be trolled. I respect what they are doing here and truly enjoy the game, and we will find out in the QOC update on the 30th of May (hopefully) how much progress they have made.
If you want to know more about their development or just need some help with the game join their discord channel. People are pretty helpful.

They will be raising the price of the game to $20 so if you want this game, buy it now, while its $10.99, or wait and support them even further.

I really look forward to seeing this game become what Romenics, Artaani and Riya dreamed of.

author: {'steamid': '76561198193540010', 'num_games_owned': 501, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1590834172}

author: {'steamid': '76561198128592391', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1553628877}
review:
Obviously I'm just getting started with this game, but it's pretty awesome so far. I'll come back and update as I get further into it, but I wanted to give the devs a little review boost.

I strongly recommend playing this game on orbital mode rather than taking the easy way out with the aerodynamic physics model. It's challenging, and takes some getting used to, but it adds a layer of strategy and planning which is just absent from other games of this type and it makes space feel alive. I'm really excited for combat using this flight model.

There's a really cool sense of autonomy in space. I was startled to see that my starting ship doesn't just have a mining laser and cargo pods, it's also got a little refinery and a factory right there on board so I can gather ores, refine them, and manufacture parts right there on my ship before returning to a station to buy and sell.

There's no getting around the fact that the tutorial needs some love. It helps, but you're really going to be figuring out this game on your own. The orbital tutorial is only for nearby objects which are relatively easy to navigate to. They really need one for distant objects as well so players can feel a little more confident getting started with orbital navigating. The play style made possible by orbital mechanics is a really exciting feature of this game, and players should be welcomed into it as comfortably and enthusiastically as possible. If you've played Kerbal you'll have a big advantage here.

The UI is also clunky. It's not a game breaker, and hot keys do a lot to smooth the way, but it's just not ergonomic in its current form.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039662795', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1637257336}
review:
After a response from the developer I am changing my review to be more suited to how I feel about the game. 

It's fun, accessible and don't be mislead, it is very much still being worked on and developed.
developer_response:
>> asked for more money to continue development

You are probably understood our text on Patreon incorrectly. Additional funding required to make development safer, easier, faster and more quality. Additional support for development is absolutely normal. It does not means that development will be abandoned, we never said that, so this is totally wrong conclusion.

Development is not stopped and will not be stopped. We are developing the game right now and we are developing it every day.
The game 100% will be complete and released.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987535631', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1527, 'last_played': 1699444377}
review:
2019-03-20
우주가 배경이지만 XY축만 사용하는 게임, 높이가 없다. 평면으로 진행되며 우주선의 각 파츠(창고나 채광레저등)를 조합하여 우주선을 만든다. 

여러대의 우주선을 사용가능하고 적과 전투하여 함교를 부순뒤 자신의 함교를 박아넣어 사용하는 것도 가능하다.

멀티는 생각보단 무난하게 돌아가는 편이며, 예전과 달리 은하맵이 업데이트되서 갑갑한 느낌도 그다지 들지않는다.

부분적으로 한글이 지원되며 플레이에 큰 지장은 없다. 스테이션에서 발주하는 임무는 번역이 되어있지않지만 배달 또는 해당 성계에서 적과의 교전 두가지뿐이라(내가 본것으로는) 문제되지않는다.

맵은 행성을 소행성과 스테이션이 공전하는 맵과 소행성과 스테이션이 한자리에 정지해있는 맵이있는데, 후자쪽이 자동이동이나 수동운전시 다루기 편하다.

요근래엔 업데이트가 잦고 점점 나아지는 것 같아서 만족스럽다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021478310', 'num_games_owned': 412, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 2149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1267, 'last_played': 1653154814}
review:
L'idea era buona ma gli sviluppatori si osno messi a fare modifiche e cercare di creare un gioco più "grosso", i risultati sono stati 3:
1. il gioco è ingiocabile perchè le stazioni sono buggate e non rigenerano risorse.
2. Il gioco non sta venendo più patchato come una volta
3. semplicemente è un gioco inutile.
Mi sono messo a giocare a delta V molto più fico e per ora non mi ha deluso.
Vecchia versione:
È un gioco molto carino per il suo genere, è abbastanza divertente anche se è un alpha ed è ancora migliorabile...
È stato sviluppato con unity.
PRO:
Puoi costruirti la tua astronave in 2D e ogni modulo ha una funziione, quindi se sbatti da qualche parte i danni si fanno sentire.
Puoi combattere, andare in giro a esplorare, andare a racogliere i container perle stazioni, combattere o cazzeggiare.
Gli sviluppatori sono persone fantastiche.
Simulazione della gravita e degli oggetti incredibilmente fatta bene.
Contro:
Alcuni piccoli bug ma che rendono il gioco ingiocabile e bisogna ricaricare.
È un alpha quindi di per se è povera di contenuti.
Grafica migliorabile.
Audio ok ma migliorabile.
Gli sviluppatori sono sul lastrico e hanno fatto un patreon quindi di sicuro il gioco non naviga in acque limpide.
L'ia non è dei migliori e l'autopilota è pessimo sopratutto nella modalità di gioco con la gravità realistica l'autopilota è quasi inutile.

Voto finale: 7/10 vale il prezzo nonostante tutto, e se i sviluppatori continueranno a lavorarci come hanno detto potrebbe diventare un gioco che seppur non in 3D come elite dangerous e non managerialissimo come x4 foundations potrà essere un ottimo videogame divertirci per giorni.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033450466', 'num_games_owned': 129, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1685877376}
review: Орбитальный режим наладили, лагов поубавилось, но что теперь с сетью? Не знаю что курят разрабы, но починив одно, сломали один из самых важных элементов. К серверам или играм друзей не присоединиться, в соло игра надоесть часов через 20 в лучшем случае. как итог эта игра просто выброшенные деньги!
developer_response:
Можете пожалуйста уточнить что именно не работает? С недавних пор не удается подключиться к серверу, а раньше все работало?

Подключение к серверу должно работать нормально, однако в некоторых случаях это невозможно из-за настроек роутера, в таких случаях надо поставить галочку UPnP при создании мира, но и UPnP может работать не всегда. Это не ошибка игры, а специфика работы сети с прямым подключением (не cloud и не relay что невозможно в этой игре из-за большого объема трафика).

Возможно, могут помочь программы вроде Hamachi.

Более детально можем обсудить в Discord.
https://discordapp.com/invite/celestialcommand

author: {'steamid': '76561198073511730', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1551927513}
review:
宇宙で採掘と研究やるゲーム、戦闘もあるらしい。

題名の通り、メインは周回軌道を制御して採掘やら研究やら交易するゲームだと思われる。
周回軌道の細かな制御をWASD+QE（サイドスラスター）で行う為、操作は難しい部類に入ると思われる。
ただし、目標地点まで移動する機能はあるので長距離移動はそこそこ楽、ただ常に周回軌道を回ってる+生成される資源岩やステーションは移動しないので接近させるのが困難ではある。

以上はこのゲームの恐らく目玉部分であるが、周回軌道OFFになるゲームモードあるため、軌道制御が面倒！という人でも安心してプレイできる。

気を付ける点としては
・ソーラーパネルは畳まれているので、モジュール選択してから展開しなければならない。あと恒星に向けないと発電できない（前後は無い）。
・建築モジュールの建築範囲に限りがあるので、初期船の全体を改造したいのなら建築ステーションを建造した方がいい。
・個体コンテナは２種類あるが、１種類を大量に保存できる方は原石専用。
・初期では飯が作れないので早急に貿易する必要がある。
・初期では燃料を生産するモジュールが建造されてないので、至急建造する。

希望としては船の操作をキーではなく、マウス操作でできるようにしたいといった所。
旋回もキーだと動きすぎるので角度をマウスで入力するみたいな操作にすると楽だと思う。

貿易ステーションと岩石の生成が重なって、ステーションが震えてドッキングできないバグに遭遇しましたが、岩石を掘り砕いたら直りました。

author: {'steamid': '76561197964124894', 'num_games_owned': 911, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 3114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1820, 'last_played': 1699204773}
review:
Development was quite slow for a while, but it's been picking up speed lately. There's a workable game here as it is.

Many ideas I had put forth to the developer were directly acknowledged, added to their development plan, and implemented.

If they keep going, I don't doubt it will turn out to be a neat little game. Just a heads up, for now, be ready to face some annoyances, most of which can be worked around without significant trouble.

author: {'steamid': '76561198442576158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1445, 'last_played': 1699115789}
review: 首先这个游戏是我喜欢的类型，而且还是还不错的游戏，可玩性也很好，喜欢沙盒类型游戏的朋友可以试试，但是游戏还处于开发阶段，中文汉化还不完整，贸易的时候都不知道买什么和卖什么。模块也是一样，不翻译都不知道这个是什么东西。希望开发组早日解决这个问题。

author: {'steamid': '76561197995142404', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 835, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 816, 'last_played': 1552974453}
review:
Pleasantly surprised by this light space sim.  I had hesitated buying Celestial Command because of some technical issues in the past, but a lot of those have been ironed out.  Also, some nice tools for the player have been added in to the game recently allowing for better gameplay overall.  

While Celestial Command doesn't have a 'steep' learning curve, it took me a little time to learn the interface and game conventions. Not bad though.  

Very relaxing pace in the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198851516854', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4068, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 600, 'last_played': 1605192565}
review:
游戏不错，但是当前版本bug不少
1、飞船与空间站之间穿模严重，建议修改模型干涉参数
2、一个货仓可以放多种物资很赞，但是货仓之间的物资转运不方便，建议优化
3、与空间站交易的时候需要选中对应货仓才能进行交易，而且不能超货仓容积，这个建议修正，至少我卖H2的时候不用每个仓点一次
4、简体中文支持不完整，建议尽快完善
5、建筑成本提高太多了，建议适当优化
6、科技点使用说明不太充分，建议优化
好的方面，我喜欢这种太空3D类的游戏；
反过来说，游戏还有很多地方需要完善，期待吸取一些homeworld的元素
加油！

author: {'steamid': '76561198347819279', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 587, 'last_played': 1547772938}

author: {'steamid': '76561198205775941', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 10580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10580, 'last_played': 1610448216}
review:
Эту игру я купил 23 марта 2017 года.
У игры был хороший потенциал, я сам отыграл в нее более 100 часов
Однако, игра стала жертвой жадных разработчиков. И сейчас обьясню почему.

Ранее игра активно обновлялась, была интересна сама задумка игры - космический симулятор в 2D пространстве, где ты сначала добывал ресурсы пытаясь не попасться пиратам, но потом сам становился как огромный пират
Последнее обновление что я помню - обновление которое принесло в игру экипаж и точки для крепления оружия, и оно было реально крутым
Но после этого существенных обновлений не было, хотя прошло уже как 3 года с того момента, вместо того чтоб развивать уже существующую задумку, разработчики решили перевести игру в 3D, Но будем честны, с полноценными 3D играми эта игра конкурировать не сможет от слова совсем.
Я прекрасно понимаю что это небольшая студия состоящая всего из 3 разработчиков и что работы много. Однако, еще в конце 2019 разработчики говорили что им не хватает денег на разработку и просили подписаться на их Patreon. И с того момента никаких особо-крупных обновлений не было. Может быть, стоило сначала закончить и доработать игру в 2D а уже потом переводить ее в 3D?
Честно, я ждал долго, очень долго, надеялся что это игра станет хорошим конкурентом уже известных космосимов. Обновлений нет, только обещания обновлений.
Что могло помочь это исправить? Сделать игру open-source проектом, или хотя бы ввести возможность моддинга. Комьюнити у этой игры хорошее, и те кто разбираются в программировании точно помогли бы в разработке. Но за 5 лет моего слежения за игрой, и за 8 лет существования игры даже это не сделали.
И разработчики все говорят что им не хватает денег, что надо их поддержать, что все скоро будет
Однако это, лишь обещания, ничего больше.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003590128', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1547399613}
review:
Es complicado.....el manejar manualmente la nave es un dolor de huevos.
Y creo que si bien hay un laburo en como recrear la fisica y simulacion del vacio sin friccion, creo que es incomodo para manejar. 
Si quiero ir del punto A al B lo quiero hacer con un click, ahora que despues gaste mas o necesite motores o demas cosas no tengo problema. Pero el estar haciendo 10mil malabares y piruetas para llegar a recorrer un pedazito de mapa....dejame de joder. Termino siempre fuera de orbita, y cuando usas el sistema automatico, de la nada recupera la trayectoria, pero vos tocas un boton para acelerar o girar y se va todo al cuerno.
Es poco intuitivo, no explica porque si funciona con el sistema automatico y no cuando apretas un boton, y tampoco es grato el elegir si queres jugar con un sistema aerodinamico o orbital cuando arrancas el juego, si quiero jugar un juego de naves espaciales no quiero un sistema aerodinamico porque no navegamos barcos con velas.
Eso te dice que no tienen un rumbo definido para el juego
Me falta probar la parte de los modulos pero esta muy verde. Si no le haces click al modulo no se abre el compartimiento y tenes que estar haciendo 20 clicks hasta dar con el cubo que queres dentro de tu nave, le hace falta un laburo grande en la interfaz. Es muy duro todo y la gente en lugar de encontrar un juego se encuentra con un simulador tosco y sin un objetivo en claro a donde inducir al jugador.
Yo esperaria a que este mas desarrollado y/o tenga alguna campaña.
developer_response:
Hello. Indeed, navigation in orbital mode could be not intuitive, but once you will learn a basics - it is very easy. We are going to implement better tutorials which should solve this issue.

A problems with interface will be fixed too.

Within a few weeks we are going to release a big update which will be focused on more intuitive game design and smoother learning curve.

Hope you will like the game after a few updates.

--------------------------
Google Translator

Hola. De hecho, la navegación en modo orbital puede no ser intuitiva, pero una vez que aprendas lo básico, es muy fácil. Vamos a implementar mejores tutoriales que deberían resolver este problema.

Un problema con la interfaz será corregido también.

Dentro de unas semanas lanzaremos una gran actualización que se centrará en un diseño de juego más intuitivo y una curva de aprendizaje más suave.

Espero que te guste el juego después de algunas actualizaciones.

author: {'steamid': '76561198882446319', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1547326930}
review: This is a amazing game. It has a steep learning curve, but once I figured it out, it was a instant 5 stars. It has a few bugs, but nothing that can't be fixed. Going with the 2D physics was a good call, I think that having 3D physics would be a little to hard. I would definitely recomend this game to anyone who likes a realistic space sim.

author: {'steamid': '76561198193723389', 'num_games_owned': 118, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1641995002}
review: It's a great game in nearly everything. The only thing I think it needs is a workshop to see ships made by people and being able to download them for the sandbox mode or their blueprints to build them in the shipyards in normal or sandbox mode

author: {'steamid': '76561198016505817', 'num_games_owned': 296, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1546484402}
review:
What in the world is this? Sure after putting in a lot of time you might start to understand it but from the basic tutorial that is given it doesn't touch how to build onto your ship or research new parts..... I read over the guides but what the heck, I have to make a station(which just the hub costs over 1million credits) to research something or have this oversized part added onto my ship just to unlock 6 moduals that are already on my starter ship? Not to mention this research bay/modual needs 300power a second which your solar panels can only support 175 units per second on top of which you need some science data units. A smaller research modual would be nice to have added as a buildable part from the start.

Sure things may change later on but with how it is now is not new player friendly, plus docking with the starter ship is such a pain wouldn't be suprised if I spend most of my play time trying to dock rather then actually play the game.
developer_response:
Hello. Sorry to hear that you are disappointed.

Tech Tree was just added recently, so we didn't implemented proper tutorial about it yet.
We realize this flaw and right now working on this aspect, so the game will be much more user friendly right from the beginning.

It will be done within a couple of weeks.

At this moment, for researching you need just to buy and attach research module on your starting ship. You may buy more solar panels, but even if you have not enough energy, research module still will work, but with lower speed.

Of course this is not too obvious and starting ship with attached research module will be much more massive and harder to control, but as mentioned above, it will be fixed quite soon.

Hope you will like the game after upcoming improvements in tutorial.
Feel free to ask in Discord chat if you will have any questions
https://discordapp.com/invite/celestialcommand

author: {'steamid': '76561198284227454', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1546357673}
review: 首先游戏虽然只有900多M，但是画面不用担心支持8K分辨率，8倍抗锯齿，但是这游戏新手引导太差了，虽然ESC里有快捷键说明但是英文的看不懂，一出生一脸懵逼连最简单的采矿都不知道怎么弄，期待完善

author: {'steamid': '76561198069421748', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1545784865}
review:
欢迎关注我们的鉴赏家52pcgame：https://store.steampowered.com/curator/26063227-52pcgame/

以目前的状态来看，Celestial Command是一款面向硬核太空模拟游戏玩家的带有4X元素的RPG游戏。这可能是一个相当令人混乱的描述，听起来仿佛是个大杂烩，一定程度也确实是如此。试着想象一个将KSP,X3和Stellaris混合在一起的游戏会是什么样？如果想象得出来的话，那么你可能多少对Celestial Command是什么样有了个正确的期待。

Celestial Command最引人注目的可能是拟真化的物理仿真轨道机制。Celestial Command的宇宙中，主要的交互依然发生在大质量天体——主要是恒星和行星——的附近。每个这样的天体周围都会形成相应的重力井，而小行星、空间站、飞船和其他人造天体就在重力井中像现实中一样围绕着中心天体运动——低轨道快，高轨道慢。因此在重力井中的移动需要完全遵循宇航学的航线规划进行变规，而且往往需要多次变轨。在体验真实航天器动力学的同时也带来了相当大的难度。

听起来很吓人？没有关系，Celestial Command还提供了较为简单的“空气动力学宇宙”模式。飞船不再会受到大质量天体的重力影响，可以像在行星表面一样只考虑自身动力进行移动。

除了轨道机制以外，Celestial同样还提供了类似于KSP的飞船自主设计功能。玩家可以随心所欲的按照自己的想法利用各种各样的模块搭建完全属于自己的飞船设计。而飞船的运动性能也和KSP一样完全基于物理仿真引擎来实现，如果设计不善的话，飞船难以旋转，无法侧向平移，或者加减速性能堪忧，都是完全可能会发生的。

除了类似KSP的物理仿真和自主设计之外，Celestial Command还提供了类似X3的任务系统以及多飞船/自建空间站系统。以及类似于Stellaris的广阔银河地图。

游戏目前也已经提供了多人模式，支持自建服务器和好友一起游玩。

在野心勃勃的游戏总体框架之外，目前Celestial的开发进度依然属于alpha中前期阶段。银河系的内容填充完成度还比较低，广阔的宇宙中只有初始星球有NPC空间站和飞船存在。多飞船和空间站也没有很好的AI支持其自主完成任务。轨道系统的尺度比例偏小也多少令人诟病。飞船设计和运动都被限制在黄道面的2维平面上也多少有些让人遗憾。

游戏虽然在EA阶段已经停留了很长时间，游戏整体框架也经历了大规模重构，但是开发者依然显得热情十足，在steam论坛和官方discord上对玩家的响应都相当及时，bug报告经常可以得到24小时内修复的承诺。因而对于游戏的后续开发是可以有所期待的。

总得来说Celestial Command看起来是一款前景相当令人期待，玩法可能会相当丰富的游戏。不过受开发进度限制，目前主要可玩内容依然集中在高拟真度的轨道运动体系上。对于不喜欢比较硬核的轨道运动体系的玩家来说可玩内容偏少。硬核轨道仿真爱好者推荐入手，其他太空探索类如X3的爱好者建议关注游戏的后续发展。

author: {'steamid': '76561198061882516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1807, 'last_played': 1650227202}
review:
Отличный симулятор космического корабля! То что нужно, чтобы весело провести время с друзьями в довольно забавной и в то же время суровой космической игре.
Тут и строительство кораблей из модулей, и зрелищные бои с пушками, бластерами, ракетами, и разлетающиеся на кусочки ранее построенные корабли, путешествия по звездным системам и довольно интересная система торговли и добычи.
Очень круто реалиованы некоторые научнофантастические теории.
Главное, что есть русский язык, пусть некоторые фразы еще переводятся в интерфейсе игры, но что еще главнее, так это то что разработчики активно стараются над своим детищем!
Так что игра стоит покупки и должной поддержки со стороны сообщества.
developer_response:
Здравствуйте!
Спасибо за отзыв! Приятно знать что люди ценят наши старания.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970393663', 'num_games_owned': 471, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2989, 'last_played': 1611170613}
review:
Without doubt one of the most addictive sandboxy games I have ever tried. I originally got the game back in 2015 I think, and had a hard time with the orbital mechanics and fuel. A lot wasn't yet implemented. I got back into it this week and have been having a great time. Orbital mechanics take some getting used to, but with patience you can get anywhere, get a fleet going and supply stations with resources to continue to get products back out of them. I just finished a warship in my orbital save now and have been hunting pirates for stations, although I am hoping when I get a warp drive and leave the system that I will start to come across pirates (not sure if they are randomly generated or just for missions)

Do yourself a favor when starting and get used to the games building/mining/trading in Aerodynamic flight mode first, will save a lot of frustration and will give you an idea of how everything works without stressing too much (stop frequenty for fuel, and remember to sell Ice to a fuel station so you can keep getting more fuel, if you don't have a fuel station, move to another system with one.)

8/10, Devs are doing a fantastic job, keep up the good work! I look forward to seeing more features come in!

There's no NPCs? It's just... empty. It feels so empty to me, without trade ships moving about, raiders teleporting in- Everything feels pretty empty and lifeless.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982051089', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 896, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 895, 'last_played': 1664492255}
review: This game is a really intresting idea.  While I have seen games kind of like it, nothing is really even the same type of game that I have played personally.  My experience on this topic is vast.  Just because the developer came up with a great idea doesn't always mean the execution wont fall short.  Thankfully, even in early access, this is not the case.  This game was playable and entertaining, even though it is / was buggy a long time ago, and the developer consistantly does a great job smashing bugs and addressing gameplay issues.  Celestial Command caters to a specific type of gamer.  It requires some micro management for sure.  I would suggest watching gameplay videos (recent as possible since EA).  If you think you will like it from watching gameplay, I promise you will.  I don't think this game is for everyone, but it's one of my favorite games right now.  The pricetag is tiny.  Being Early Access and from a small developer I wouldn't want to pay $50 for it, but it's worth at least $25 and it seems to never be that high.  Kudos to the dev for not being greedy.  I really hope you try this game because its quite amazing.  Also, if you haven't played in a while, take a look.  I have seen lots of good progress recently.
developer_response:
Thanks you very much for review! We glad you like the game! : )
We will make it even better in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969108269', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 705, 'last_played': 1540739881}
review:
At the time of writing this I've only played the game for 7 hours straight and that's all on a sunday.  From these seven hours I see a very promising game.  I didn't have any problems with the tutorial, it all ran through great for me.  

There are a couple of bugs but that's part of the fun of Early Access Games.  Knowing how well games can progress with a decent team and gamers like ourselves behind them, then I'm glad to be part of the experience.

Having played Kerbal, Elite Dangerous, Astroneer, Star Citizen, No Man's Sky, Space Engineers, and a few other space games over the years, this definitely looks like it has potential.
developer_response:
Thanks you very much for review!
We glad you like the game.
Also, recently we redesigned a tutorial and we glad that it was helpful and enjoyable for you : )

author: {'steamid': '76561198047251731', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 587, 'last_played': 1527887859}
review:
Многобещающая космическая песочница, из самого весёлого занятия - ускорение времени  и наблюдение за смещением орбит от вышеуказанного действия. 

Можно поаутировать некоторое время в добычу ресурсов из астеройдов и пострелушки с ИИ на кораблях, которые сам же и спроектировал.

Выглядит мило, ждём контента. (И возможно моды с мастерской)

author: {'steamid': '76561197981736706', 'num_games_owned': 573, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1409, 'last_played': 1608704395}
review:
I purchased Celestial Command much closer to it's Alpha release. Back then it only had orbital mechanics and a lot of features were being fleshed out and still in development.

Since then I've seen a lot of feed back to developers, and a lot of changes in the game. Features have become more solid, more enjoyable and it's really taking shape. Now is definitely the time to pick this game up. It's gearing up to feel very 4x but on a 2d plane with 3d graphics which is fantastic. 3d planes can be a bit cumbersome and isn't always better. This will allow a lot more focus on the fun gameplay apsects and less working out 3d logisitcs of everything so that the gameplay can really be top notch.

Designing your own ship is neat, it's nice how it snaps together and center of mass matters. We've had to create utility ships to brin fuel refining to remote areas that we're mining, it allows you to easily switch and control ships you own. Definitely recommend this game.
developer_response:
Thanks you very much for review!
We are really glad you like the game. It is important for us.
We will work hard in order to make the game complete and perfectly polished! : )

author: {'steamid': '76561197966391335', 'num_games_owned': 913, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1538941875}
review:
Annoying piece of trash from the start of development to the current stage, it has not improved in playability since it was added to early access many years ago.
Do not buy.


[h1]Response to developer response:[/h1]
You did all that, and it still remains an unplayable annoying mess.
It's like slapping a bunch of completely random objects together with some duct tape and calling it a house.
Keyword: Playability, not content or features as you so vehemently failed to read or understand.
developer_response:
Excuse me, but your review is not correct.

The part "not improved" have no any sense. This game have the most larger amount of improvements during development than any other game which we know.

Just take a look:

After first release, this was a simple 2D game without good UI and even without save load.

After that, 1 year later, we are completely redesigned entire game, replaced every module, visual effect, asteroid and planet, so now the game have full 3D graphics.

After another year, we are completely redesigned a trading system, implemented completely new inventory and production system, implemented a huge galaxy with different types of planets, stars, black holes and asteroids fields.

Recently we improved multiplayer a lot so now everyone is able to host the server and lag compensation between connected players now should be nearly perfect!

And right now we are working on a capital ships which should be added within 1-2 weeks.
https://steamcommunity.com/gid/103582791436739024/announcements/detail/1683675396460788874

Not to mention that we are answering absolutely on every message and fix all bug reports which we receive.

So can you please clarify definition of "not improved"?

author: {'steamid': '76561198020981093', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1552420789}
review: After spending several frustrating hours at this game, I am now inclined to say to save your money. There are several key elements to this game that are missing, under developed, or just plain broken. The tutorial is vastly under developed, the issues present make everything maddeningly frustrating, and I shouldn't have to spend hours reading through outdated forums trying to pick apart what works and what doesnt. Save your money, this is a concept and needs a lot more work before it should have been released.
developer_response:
Thanks for review.
Indeed, some aspects may have serious bugs or flaws. But definitely not "everything".

This is a complex game with many complex features, so it is not an easy task to create a comfortable user interface and tutorial for each aspect of the game.
But we are constantly working on improvements of usability and fixing the most critical bugs. Currently there is not so many of them actually. Earlier the game was really bugged, but now we are fixed most of critical bugs. The rest of them will be solved pretty soon.

Information in this Guide is pretty up-to-date
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=557510735

Also if you will have any issues, feel free to contact with us in the Discord chat:
https://discordapp.com/invite/celestialcommand
We are answering to everyone and in many cases reply almost instant.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992167530', 'num_games_owned': 224, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1595797256}

author: {'steamid': '76561198022209208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 4371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1375, 'last_played': 1699893110}
review:
The basics are certainly there and this could be a really awesome game, but it is currently has some flaws and a lack of content. You can see the potential which makes the current state a bit more frustrating. There is no satisfying end you can reach yet, it's just a question of how far you can go before you hit the wall and quit.

Most importantly, the construction mechanics are tedious and make it borderline impossible to construct anything.

- You can not move parts, not to speak of moving entire sections.
- If you want to change something you have to deconstruct/sell and reconstruct/buy it all over again. Which is made worse by the weird menu structure of constantly selecting the station switching between buy and sell.
- Detaching parts just catapults them away in the best case and makes everything explode in the worst case.
- The tractor beam is totally unusable
- The engineering module range is pathetic
- Everything requires too many types of resources. Resources which are impossible to get or would take days to farm.

Construction needs the ability to move parts and sections with snapping the same way you would place new parts. Add a tractor beam effect from the station/ship if necessary.

Another problem is that several features that you can see in old youtube videos have been removed.

- Construction via drones has been removed even though it seems a much better way than the current state
- Shipyards and charging stations are nowhere to be found. Actually beyond the 3 start station there seems to be nothing in the world. There seems to be no point in going anywhere (yet)
- Large Asteroid and asteroid with more exotic materials are nowhere to be found.
- Orbital transferring between planets has been removed
- Spawning as construction or command ship has been removed.
- The RCS cluster module has been removed, now you have to place 4 part instead of 1.

Some minor things like

- States of modules is not saved
- Ship/UI Settings are not saved
- Balance of hydroponic, fuel production energy usage seems off
- Your own orbital line constantly disappears and you have to select yourself to see it, but then you can't select your target
- Warpgate randomly not working
- You come out at the wrong warpgate
- No way to get more crew and Transferring crew is annoying
- Reaction wheels don't seem to do anything
- You can exploit the trade system by buying 2000, wait for price rise, selling 2000, wait for price drop, repeat

It's still a thumps up, because what they have is very good. Concept, Art direction, Flight Controls, Orbital Mechanics, Trading, Mining are all solid. You can get 5-10 hours of the activities (mining, salvaging, retrieval, gas-collection, trade, combat) and 5-10 hours if you are more hardcore and attempt to build a few small ships and stations. But as soon as you want to go for bigger and better things, you realize the game blocks you or has nothing to offer outside of the start system (yet). Which is ok for early access.

If they fix construction and add a proper progression as you go to new planets and systems, maybe even exploration mysteries to uncover, infrastructure to build, this could be the next Kerbal Space Program + Subnautica.
developer_response:
Thanks you for the big and detailed review.

You are totally right about construction. First it was our intention to make construction harder, so you need to move modules manually using grabber and second ship, but now we realized that it is not a feature, it is a flaw, which should be fixed. So we will make it possible to just drag and drop modules using a mouse, this should make construction process much more satisfying.
Thanks for suggestion, it is really important aspect of the game.

-------------------------------

Now about removed features:

"- Construction via drones has been removed even though it seems a much better way than the current state"

It is necessary in order to make the game better. It is explained here:

https://trello.com/c/WB6s9LZF


"- Shipyards and charging stations are nowhere to be found. Actually beyond the 3 start station there seems to be nothing in the world. There seems to be no point in going anywhere (yet)
- Large Asteroid and asteroid with more exotic materials are nowhere to be found."

It will be fixed in the next, big trading update, we have big plans for trading, it should be great when it will be done.

"- Orbital transferring between planets has been removed"

It is super necessary in order to make the game much better than before. The game losing nothing, but achieved a lot. It is explained here:

https://steamcommunity.com/gid/103582791436739024/announcements/detail/1575563008254546788
https://steamcommunity.com/gid/103582791436739024/announcements/detail/1649886349638834858

And especailly in the comments here:
https://steamcommunity.com/gid/103582791436739024/announcements/detail/3228394392749716885

"- Spawning as construction or command ship has been removed."

This is okay, it because in survival \ career mode player should start from small ship and earn credits and resources for bigger ships.

"- The RCS cluster module has been removed, now you have to place 4 part instead of 1."

It is better, isn't it? Since it is construction game, you have more flexibility. Also, only part of engines could be destroyed which is very good for physics.

---------------------------------

About minor things.
Thanks, these things already added in to-do list and will be fixed according to its priority.


Overall, thanks you for the positive review! We are glad that you like the game and its potential, we are definitely will add a lot more amazing features and will fix all of these flaws! : )

author: {'steamid': '76561198289305245', 'num_games_owned': 20, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 601, 'last_played': 1621448531}
review: A la fois simple et réaliste! Tuto incomplet mais interface simple pour compenser, le genre de jeu que je cherchais depuis longtemps. Le vaisseau qu'on construit devient automatiquement joli esthétiquement lorsqu'il est efficace.  Vivement le multijoueur massif!

author: {'steamid': '76561197988251651', 'num_games_owned': 1547, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1529768904}
review:
Hesitant recommend.  I really like the idea of this game and love the orbital mechanics, but there is also where the biggest issue with this game is.  The orbital mechanics are horrible.  

Take for instance rotation.  Use the rotation stabilizer to come to a dead stop (rotation wise) and then turn it off.  Speed up time and the ship starts rotating again.  Also, rotating the ship affects the orbit, which it should not at all.  Another issue, when docked at a space station, the orbit line jitters like crazy.  The orbit should be rock solid while docked.  Also, while docked I noticed the space station was about to hit a warp gate.  The warp gate did a weird slide around the station and then shot off further in orbit.  

Another problem in the game is the interface.  The buy/sell is incredibly hard to use, but at least looking at the roadmap, that is being worked on.  The shipyard is a real pain in the ass to use.  Sometimes attaching a new module wouldn't work properly and it would go flying off at hyper speed or crash into my ship.   (another mechanics issue here as well, detaching a part from a ship while docked, the part should just kind of float next to the ship, it does not, it goes flying at high speed and detonates).  Also, I couldn't figure out how to move peices around, it just detaches them and they go accelerating off like missles.
developer_response:
Thanks you for review.

Yes, your reports is completely reasonable. We realize important of these aspects. It is added in our to-do list and will be solved as soon as possible.

Also about "rotating the ship affects the orbit, which it should not at all" - actually it is not a bug. If maneuvering engines is not balanced around center of mass, the ship will be a bit shifted and this will change an orbit, this is how physics works in real world, it is just not noticeable for real space ships due much larger scales of planets. But small planets it is an idea of the game.

However, sometimes it could be hard to balance engines around center of mass, so we will add a tools which will simplify this process.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036822680', 'num_games_owned': 321, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1042, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 794, 'last_played': 1701809380}
review:
It needs some serious rebalancing for the non-sandbox mode and the multiplayer, but the core is solid and shows potential.

Currently the gameplay is slow, and you will make frequent use of the adjustable simulation speed, which can introduce some pacing issues with multiplayer as well as precision thrust difficulties. 

The Devs are great, responding to bug reports etc. with unprecedented speed, quite a nice change from the cash grab early access titles. An example of someone reporting a bug: https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/322845485930905611/501022681999736832/unknown.png

They also take suggestions to heart: https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/375702992558751774/502299334998753282/unknown.png

If playing solo or perhaps with a single friend, then the game certainly is serviceable at the moment and It has potential for great things.

[Previous review was negative due to insane multiplayer bugs, these have been fixed and this is why there is a developer response]
developer_response:
Thanks for review.
Indeed, earlier the game had some serious bugs with multiplayer.

But now we are gladly to say that multiplayer was improved a lot in huge update 0.86!
https://steamcommunity.com/gid/103582791436739024/announcements/detail/1694932494308365776

And even more important improvements was done in version 0.6812
https://steamcommunity.com/gid/103582791436739024/announcements/detail/1687051828748574313

Now everyone should be able to host the server, and movement of objects in multiplayer is so smooth so it is nearly perfect!
Trading and quests now working in multiplayer, and most another features too.

There is still some bugs in the multiplayer (such as, players can't load a blueprints from sandbox menu), but it will be fixed as soon as possible.
Overall, multiplayer already should be playable.

We would ask you to revisit the game.
If you will have any issues, please contact to us directly via Discord chat, and we will solve this ASAP.
https://discordapp.com/invite/celestialcommand

author: {'steamid': '76561198324696616', 'num_games_owned': 374, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 1488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1488, 'last_played': 1612070127}
review: Envolez-vous vers les étoiles dans Celestial Command, le jeu de simulation de vaisseau spatial où votre seule limite est l'infini de l'univers ! Dans ce jeu de construction et d'exploration spatiale, vous pouvez concevoir et piloter votre propre vaisseau spatial, explorer des mondes extraterrestres et vous battre contre d'autres factions galactiques. Avec des graphismes époustouflants, une physique réaliste et des possibilités de construction infinies, Celestial Command vous offre une expérience de jeu captivante et immersive, où vous pouvez jouer votre rôle dans la conquête de l'espace et la découverte de nouveaux horizons.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041646924', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1749, 'last_played': 1703634018}
review: I can now give this game a recommend! it has updated and fixed lots of prevelant and big issues that prevented me from playing before!
developer_response:
Sorry to hear that.

The reason why there is not update during 4 months because we are working on the super big update which will bring a lot of important features and fixes. This is the most important update which will push the game on the new level.

You may read more about here:
https://steamcommunity.com/games/CelestialCommand/announcements/detail/1575563008254546788
And here:
https://steamcommunity.com/games/CelestialCommand/announcements/detail/3228394392749716885

>> its to complicated to have them flying in a 3 dimensinal plane

Not exactly. It is not a complicated, it is just unnecessary for the game design, because it will broke an idea of physics (main feature of the game)
You may read more about here:
https://steamcommunity.com/games/CelestialCommand/announcements/detail/1475349666903038934


AI and crew is not broken, they are just not fully complete. Please keep in mind that it is early access and the game have a lot of complex features. And we are just a 3 developers, we need a time to polish everything.

>> lack of development and talk from developers

We are surprised to hear that, because the game in very active development every day and we are answering on every message in Steam Community Hub and Discord. You may open any random thread in the steam hub and most likely you will found our answer, except someone else already answered on a question.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006833353', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1381, 'last_played': 1519828845}
review: This game should be epic but even as a late comer to the game I find it just too hard to play, the orbital mechanics are an awesome section to the game I was really looking forward to harvesting asteroids and building a dyson swarm and even tring to link some of the stations together to allow easier trading however after the 700th time of being blone to bits by a planet or rougue asteroid you just loose interest, even when you play on slow speed and rely on the auto game mechanics like stablise orbit you still plow into planets more often than not as the distances between planets etc are laughably small (needed to make the game take hours not months of course) means you have ZERO time to take any sort of corrective action, one small thrust in the wrong direction on a heavy ship and you have an uncontrolable decaying orbit and boom! there goes your 45 min of waiting to catch up to a roid and mine it..... even regular game saves and reverting back every 20 min just spoils the game as you feel like you are cheating. This game SHOULD be bloody amazing and to my much sorrow it just is not :( a few small tweeks would probably correct everything but as the game has been in beta for a zillion years there is unlikely to be a huge team working on this so will not be holding my breath. Such a shame.
developer_response:
Thanks you for review.
Don't worry, we will not abandon the game and we will develop it to the perfect state.

Seems like a warning message "Your ship on unstable trajectory" and "Impact in 10 seconds, auto stabilizer enabled" feature should solve a reason why you are unhappy with the game.

This feature already in plan. We will let you know once it will be done.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973087307', 'num_games_owned': 276, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 558, 'last_played': 1574014080}
review:
Le jeu est plus polish qu'avant, il y a un tutoriel. Malgre le fait que le jeu propose la langue francaise et bien quasiment tout le jeu reste en anglais.
Les controles sont bien plus approximatifs qu'avant, la molette est mal geree, la camera est affreusement lente, quand au vaisseau il faut deviner sa presence on peut rapidement le perdre.
On sent quand meme que le UI est mieux qu'avant, mais ca s'arrete la. Le tutoriel est penible, le joueur est laisse a l'abandon derriere un texte qui te parle d'element sans te les montrer.
La cerise sur le gateau reste le controle du vaisseau. Si vous voulez aller toutdroit, oubliez ca dessuite. Franchement c'est la derniere fois que je joue a ce Jeu car je n'ai aucun plaisir a y jouer.

Les Pros:
- [strike]Le jeu est complexe[/strike]
- [strike]Le côte sandbox est très plaisant[/strike]

Les cons:
- [strike]Aucun tutoriel, la prise en main est catastrophique[/strike]
- Le jeu manque de contenu.
- Les contrôles sont [strike]difficiles[/strike] juste mauvais.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011519956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 4027, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1105, 'last_played': 1670186008}
review: I've been playing BossConstructor intensely; this game closely resesmbles it - however, this is much more realistic.  I like the options for the physics - between aerodynamic (air friction) and/or orbital dynamics (space). I particularly love the sandbox - as I enjoy experimenting with the different parts and how they interact with the physics.  I'm still figuring out some of the items, particularly the weaponry.  Not sure if it's a setting or an AI-issue as the missile battery will fire into the hull trying to hit an enemy on the other side.  Lasers seem a bit more inuitive, but require a lot of power.  Absolutely love the game, and will continue playing & experimenting with what it has to offer thus far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002866749', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1531552504}
review:
ANALISE EM PORTUGUES!

Antes de tudo, gostaria de felicitar os desenvolvedores do jogo. Existe claramente um compromisso com a criação de um jogo de qualidade.
Comprei o jogo a pouco tempo e pelo pouco que joguei, gostei muito do estágio de desenvolvimento.
Gostaria de deixar algumas impressões iniciais sobre o que testei até agora.

1- Muito bom designer e modelagem  do jogo, muito imersivo.
2- Excelente jogabilidade, gostei muito da física, pilotar a nave é agradável sem ser massante.
3- Com poucas horas de jogabilidade, posso ver inúmeras possibilidades de progressão, em nenhum momento me senti perdido, mesmo que o jogo não tenha um vasto tutorial.
4- Otimização do jogo muito boa, roda perfeitamente sem qualquer tipo de perda de quadros.
5- Lindos gráficos da representação do sistema estelar inicial do jogo.
6- Facilidade na construção e desenvolvimento de naves do jogo, tudo muito intuitivo sem tirar profundidade e complexibilidade. 


>> ENGLISH REVIEW <<


First of all, I would like to congratulate the developers on the game. There is clearly a commitment to creating a quality game.
I bought the game a short time and for the little that I played I liked very much the stage of development of it.
I would like to leave some initial impressions of what I have tested so far.

1- Very good designer and modeling game, very immersive.
2- Excellent gameplay, I liked the physics very much, to pilot the ship is pleasant without being massante.
3- With few hours of gameplay I can see countless possibilities for progression, at no time did I feel lost even the game not having a vast tutorial.
4- Optimization of the game very good, fluid wheel without any kind of loss of frames.
developer_response:
Thanks you for review. 
We glad you like the game. It encourages us to develop the game : )

author: {'steamid': '76561198191301505', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1516451825}
review:
带生存模式的2.5D简单火箭。可惜既不够简单，也不怎么火箭。

UI设计非常糟糕，到处是乱七八糟的弹窗，字还特别大。最关键的信息（飞行时的轨道信息、对接时的相对速度/距离、采矿时的货舱容量等）没有突出显示，反而是“有新的任务可以接了”这种提示每隔几分钟就会弹一次，每次要占掉1/3屏幕。
教程敷衍了事，开始还“请点击高亮的按钮”，其实就是在按钮上画个不明显的黄圈（有时候还画歪了）。后面甚至连黄圈都省了，就告诉你按钮名称让你自己点着玩，操作技巧之类更是完全没有，那还不如学dcs放个pdf文档。玩了一个小时，愣是没搞明白怎么丢弃货物、怎么改变部件位置（或者它根本不支持这些功能？）。
想esc看下按键设置，居然还不会自动暂停要手动点暂停。
没有轨道规划、自动切换参考系等基础功能，再加上地图小轨道周期短，基本就只能朝着目的地直线飞行然后不断修正误差（教程也是这么教的），甚至官方还推荐玩带空气阻力的模式。这游戏的科学性基本也就和太空工程师一个水平了。硬核？不存在的。

author: {'steamid': '76561198031569438', 'num_games_owned': 451, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1516480961}
review: Very fun little game. Controls are clunky af though. It seems like they can't decide whether to go full on orbital mechanics to appease the type of people who like KSP, or stick with arcade controls to make it easier for an easier experience. I really do like the concept though. Will be watching it to see where it goes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025078510', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1558981681}

author: {'steamid': '76561197983777398', 'num_games_owned': 180, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 381, 'last_played': 1699353410}
review:
Really great game with huge potential, please don't screw it up.

EDIT: Yep, they screwed-up

author: {'steamid': '76561197979544950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 10018, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1674862255}
review:
MÜKEMMEL BİR OYUN OLUYOR.
Birileri şu adamlarım elinden tutsa, sponsor olsa, ne güzel olur.du... Adamların yaptıkları ilk oyun . Tam anlamıyla profesyonel de değiller, ama ortaya çıkardıkları oyun şahaser olmaya aday diye bilirim.
11,11,2019 - 30 Saate yakın oynama sürem ile (100 saat olmuş bile, hiç anlamadım ^^ )   Bazı eklemeler yapmak istiyorum. Çok zaman geçmiş. Hala oyunun pek çok eksiği var. Aslında eksik demek yanlış olur. Zira oyunun potansiyeli çok fazla ve Gele bileceği yerleri, yapıla bilecek şeyleri görüpte, Bir an önce o seviyede görme arzusu desek daha doğru olur. Şu anda bile gayet oynanabilir bir seviyede, gayet eğlenceli zaman geçirtiyor.  Oyuna Türkçe dil desteği gelmiş diyemeyiz. çok hataları var, eksikleri var. İngilizce olarak oynamak zorunda kaldım, en azından bu şekilde hatasız bir menü ile bu tip oyunlara aşina olanlar, çok zorlanmadan, anlayarak oynayabilirler. Türkçe oynanabilir seviyede değil ne yazık ki..Geçen süre içinde bende ikna oldum artık. senaryosu olmayan bir oyuna Türkçe menü çok gerekli değil. Zira 1-2 saat içinde neyin ne olduğunu çözüp, aynı tadda bir oyun keyfi alabilmek pek ala mümkün.... Oyun bağımsız yapımcı olan 3 arkadaş tarafından yapılıyor, Romanyalı bu arkadaşlar, gayet güzel ve yaratıcı bir oyun ortaya çıkarmışlar, onlarca belkide yüzlerce kişinin hazırladığı, sağlam sponsorların ve profesyonellerin hazırladıkları oyunlarla kıyasladığımızda, çok çok iyi bir iş ortaya çıkardıklarını söyleyebilirim. Oyun son zamanlarda artan bir hızla güncelleniyor. Patriondan  aldıkları destek ile ki halen hedeflerinden çok uzaktalar, gelen bağışları iyi bir şekillde değerlendirdiklerini düşünüyorum. Umarım hedeflerine ulaşabilirler. Bu oyunun bitmiş halini görmeyi çok istiyorum.. Tavsiyem alınması yönünde hala... Bitmemiş hali ile dahi, iyi vakit geçrtiyor. sanırım 100 saat oynama süresinde galakside anca 3-5 yıldız sistemi görebilicem.. yaratıcılığın sonu yok, bu tarz oyunlar kendini çok uzun süre oynatır. Bu arada bundan sonra gelecek olan güncelleme ile sanırım oyunun crafting ve grafik kısmı oldukça gelişecek. gemi ve istasyonlar artık tam olarak 3 boyutlu olarak modellenecek..şu anda modülleri yan yana dizerek craft yapabiliyoruz., üst üstede katmanlı olarak ta yapılabilirse, bu oynama süresini çok çok arttırır. Hayal gücünün sınırı yok. Bilen bilir. Oyunun başında saatlerce gemi ve istasyon tasarlarız artık. Yılbaşında indirime girmeden alın. indirim beklemeyin. zaten ücreti çok değil, bu oyun için az bile. Hiç olmazsa adamlara katkısı olur... Patrionda bağış yapmak isteyenlere de çok güzel bir komplimanları var. Miktara göre uzay istasyonlarına, yıldız sistemlerine random olarak adınız verilecekmiş.. Ben bir kaç Türk ismi gördüm. Bu çok hoşuma gitti.  5 yıldız 10 numara olamaya aday. Satın alın, oynayın, ,oynattırın...


[b] 27.12.2020 Oyun erken erişim olduğu için, kimseyi yanıltmamak ve objektif olabilmek adına, ara ara incelememi güncellemek zorunluluğu hissediyorum. Bu bağlamda; Oyun evet ilk aldığım oyun değil, güzel güncellemeler geldi, Fakat çok çok yavaş gelişen bir oyun. Uzun zamandan beri düzgün bir güncelleme gelmedi.  Artık oyunun güncelleme haberlerini takip etmekten vazgeçtim. Şu an için fiyat performans yeterli değil. [/b]

9 Temmuz 2021 Son değerlendirmemden itibaren 7 ay geçmiş,. Oyun aynı yerde duruyor. Sanırım bundan sonrası bu şekilde olacak. Oyuna başka bir güncelleme gelmeyecek ve günün birinde tamam bu kadar bitti diyecekler... Güzel bir indirime denk gelirseniz alın. Oyun kötü değil... Kötü olan potansiyeli bu kadar  iyi olan bir oyunun geliştirilmiyor oluşu. Çok çok daha iyi bir oyun olabilirdi, yazık...

author: {'steamid': '76561197990494580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 3003, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1339, 'last_played': 1592095380}
review:
There's something about the 2D orbital mechanics that is challenging, and even demanding, given fuel limitations, yet not too challenging. Based on the size of the ships in the video, I've got a ways to go to. My little armed miner is just eeking out an existence, slowly expanding in capacity and power.

It is early access, so there are bugs, and things are still being added, but, nothing game breaking for me. One is a save bug, but the workaround is to always exit to the main menu and reload a save game from there, not from within a currently-running game. The asteroids within my starting system have mostly all disappeared, but this may be due to collisions and being sucked into the planet, which I have observed. There are 5 planets in my system and an asteroid belt, so plenty of things to mine, but it doesn't appear that the asteroids close to my starting planet will respawn. But there should be a decent supply of rocks to mine in the belt. Another weakness is the tutorial will be tough to get through. It took me several tries before I made matched orbit with three asteroids and then a station. The tutorial is a little bit like a rouge-like game, so you have to just keep restarting it until you can perform the tasks faster with less fuel use and make it to the station to complete the tutorial while docked. 

I play with the more-difficult frictionless space version. There is also an easier 'atmospheric' mode that is easier to fly around in, but that would kill a lot of the challenge and sense of danger. One wrong burn, and I may burn up in the planet's atmosphere, or my ship may be come a graveyard when I run out of fuel and then food. 

The space version with more-realistic orbital mechanics is challenging, but doable, once you learn some techniques. Just remember that lower orbits move faster than higher orbits. You can push down to a lower orbit to catch up with something, and then push up to match the orbit of the target object. If you don't know how to get a circular orbit, there is an auto-stabilize orbit button that will save your bacon. Once you are in close orbit to your target, you can use a relational-velocity indicator to help in your piloting attempt to latch onto an asteroid or dock with a station.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141332661', 'num_games_owned': 345, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1601624303}
review:
-----------------2017.11.23---------------------
更得很勤，可以看出制作方很用心。
问题bug还是很多，但看到旧版本游戏后发现进步很多。希望最后别没开发完就跑路了……
-----------------2017.11.21---------------------
现今阶段不是很推荐这款游戏。
在退出到主菜单时有时候会切换回英文。有时候退出游戏，重进游戏后游戏设置（声音和语言）还原。碰到过一次空间站贴图消失的问题。……给人的感觉bug很多。
单就游戏本身的出发点来说还好。解决了开发上的硬伤后应该能算得上一款看的过去的游戏。
总体而言，游戏两种模式。太空模式属于叫做画虎不成反成犬类的感觉。太空中靠近物体从来不是直接靠近。希望开发者能加入轨道编辑器之类的东西。
而另一种游戏模式则使得游戏成为自由版2D画面游戏（参见x3系列）。这种模式下，只要开发者能够给予游戏者一些目的。可玩性就比较高。
游戏除了bug的问题外就是建造的问题。通过连接点实现站外建造是在太过烦人。
**等到bug基本上除完的时候我会推荐这款游戏的。**

author: {'steamid': '76561198096608094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 155, 'playtime_forever': 426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1511311157}
review: This game is very, very unfinished. Basic mechanics like shipbuilding run into cumbersome annoyances, and the interface needs a ton of work. Still, it's a pleasure to play -- I don't know of any other game that offers the relaxing and cerebral challenge of lining up realistic orbits to get where you're going, or balancing your ship's weight distribution for the benefit of the thrusters. And the shipbuilding is surprisingly deep and flexible.

THIS IS ONE AWESOME GAME!! I love the ship building and exploration aspect also so keep expanding the game in all directions from exploration of space to mining to conquest to engineering of ships this game rocks!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025192293', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2944, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1902, 'last_played': 1672087710}
review:
This is a really fun game. I've played more hours than I care to admit in the two or three days I've owned it. :)

You can explore, mine, build, design and customize your ships, and fight baddies with lasers, cannons, rockets, torpedoes. - salvaging and pillaging the ruinous remnants of their hulking ships  for base materials or repurpose modules for your own use. You can spin and accelerate your ship round and round and round in a zero-resitance environment like a centerfuge and imagine gleefully the havoc it would play on your crews' innards, all the while visualizing the playful effect of physics on the viscera and fluids locked inside those stalwart metal hulls (not that I would do that, of course...). What's not to love?! I hear capturing bases and ships is in the future?

I haven't explored the multi-player option yet but fun with friends is good. 

The tutorial needs expanding (as the devs have already said) but it gives the basics. Patience, curiosity and experimentation will show the rest for now. Google can help. ;)

Also, there are shields and tractor beams. Can't wait to play it in its finished state.

Buy the game!
