author: {'steamid': '76561198073615481', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 732, 'last_played': 1644411614}
review:
Celistial Command это перспективная но давольно так медленно развивающийся космический сандбокс. Это сандбокс про строительство, полеты, добычу ресурсов на орбите. Да именно так на орбите. В этой игре есть орбитальная механика вроде КСП или Орбитра так что опыт тех игр может вам пригодится - особенно опыт стыковки. 

Промышленность же сдесь больше похожа на космические инженеры. Копаем астероиды добываем разнообразные руды.  Перевариваем астероиды.  Производим детальки и строим из них корабль. Разве что тут человечком летать не придется и сваривать. И вообще человечки тут сидят внутри корабля и мы распределяем их между отсеками - это отдаленно напоминает на управление в стратегии.  Разрабы постоянно перепиливают систему производства так что пока не извесно какой она будет в будующем. 

В игре есть все заделы для боев. Корабли которые могут ломатся на части. Оружие и щиты которые правда разрабы то включают в игру то вырезают и что то там переделывают.  Бой с орбитальной механикой это что то с чем то. 

В игре сейчас заниматся особо нечем кроме как тренироватся в бурении астероидов при условиях орбиталньой механике а это поверте сложно. Так что лучше подождать когда игру всетаки еще улутшат или купит ьна солидной скидке. А сейчас это нестабильный сырой продукт над котором бесконца ведутся различные экспиременты вроде перепиливания промышленности. Хотя можно отдать должно у меня игра работает стабильно, без крашев вылетов и прочей хрени так что поиграть в нее всетаки можно.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054750485', 'num_games_owned': 142, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1552416642}
review:
Le concept du jeu est là et il est bon ! Mon avis sera donc dans l'état actuel du jeu, l'early access et sera donc le reflet de mes impressions actuelles.
Malheureusement dans son état actuel je ne le conseille pas du tout !!!!
Beaucoup de bugs, un sytéme de déconstruction à revoir entiérement et un manque de fonctions de bases telles que pouvoir assigner un container à telle ou telle ressource etc...
Les assignations de touches ne fonctionnent pas correctement et impossible de faire fonctionner plusieurs laser de minage en même temps par exemple... 
Du côté possibilités de construction, il y a du choix mais il en faudra encore plus pour réussir le tout.
A l'heure de ce commentaire les développeurs semblent travailler sur l'AI, étape trop tôt, les bugs cités ci-dessus devraient être d'abord corrigés car sortir des nouveautés c'est bien, mais sur un jeu buggé, c'est le plus court chemin pour un désastre d'accumulation de bugs.

Je n'ai pas testé le multijoueur, qui, vu les bugs trop nombreux, est totalement inutile pour le moment.

Vu le prix certes je le conserve mais j'espère que ce jeu va évoluer positivement et rapidement car il risque de vite tomber dans l'oubli :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198001601065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1443448408}
review:
I really liked the idea of real orbital mechanics (having played KSP and loved that game!), however I had forgotten how darned hard it is, and how much TIME it takes! Waiting to set up orbital maneuvers and fiddling to rendevouz with asteroids and stations.

The game was simply too time-consuming and hard for me, I wish there were some simple tools to make it easier to align correctly with other objects. The resources node system also got the better of me. I played half an hour, and got too frustrated to continue.

If you've got the skills and the time, I think this could be a very interesting game to follow. For me, I'll just be looking for something more casual for the time being.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053630261', 'num_games_owned': 434, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1592913577}
review:
Definetly an amazing concept. As a Kerbal Space Program addict I must say this is one that you should pickup if you are too and would like to support its development (it is EARLY ACCESS after all).

It is in essence a 2D space sim where you build a ship part-by-part in space and go about mining (so far) and surviving. Your crew will need food and your ship will need power and fuel. Build a bigger ship with more storage and more power, lasers and crew, and you will find yourself having a blast.

It's space physics/orbital mechanics is quite well simulated but do note, this is an early access so expect there to be lots of work to be done until release. You will find there is little content but the devs are working hard at it. For now your challenge will be trying to get more and more food and fuel to survive without flinging yourself into an asteriod.

It has a fairly steep learning curve for new-comers and even more so new-comers to the space sim genre but I'd highly suggest to take a peak at the guides and experiment how modules connect and transfer resources.

More parts will be coming as well as AI ships filling the universe with life and dangers throughout its systems.

A work in progress but looks very promising thus far. Going to keep an eye on this one as it develops.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125427607', 'num_games_owned': 233, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1372, 'last_played': 1574550328}
review:
This is a game I come back to every once in a while and this being an early access game it changes every time I do. I am always blown away by the changes. Every time I am surprised and relive the game over again. At the point of of writing this review the game is much bigger than previous time I played it. I haven't seen all the new stuff yet but I expect I'd be equally  (or more) amazed as when the game went from 2d to a 3d.

I feel like the developers don't have an end goal they want the game to be, but instead listen to the community and change the things that need to be changed. In other words the dev team is awesome and this is visible in the game. This might bring financial problems so just buy the game if you like space and everyone will be able to keep having fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198237577814', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 2054, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 807, 'last_played': 1641175065}
review:
If you've played the excellent SimpleRockets, you are already familiar with terms like gravitational sphere of influence, apogee, perigee, Hoffman transfers, retrograde and prograde burns. If not, you may want to try playing SimpleRockets to give you the basics or read up on the terms online. You will need to know what these mean. 

To begin, this is an awesome game. You can travel within a solar system using several modes of propulsion. You can orbit planets and go to space stations. You can mine asteroids and shoot at things with a ship of your own design. You can do all of this in sandbox mode (it will give you things you need from a sandbox menu) or not (in which case you better know what you are doing). I really suggest using the sandbox mode until you are comfortable navigating and modifying your spaceship.

I haven't tried muliplayer yet but I did start my own instance of a server so I can experiment in. Set a password you will remember so you are the only one to get into your instance. In this mode you are given a ship and are in orbit around a planet randomly spawned. Read the F1 help text carefully as it will get you familiar. Anything you need to build or remove from your ship is done in engineering.  You can build and destroy engines, power sources, solar panels, , reactors, corridors, cargo holds, command decks, struts, fuel tanks, a radar system, various weapons, a grapple hook, and a mining laser.

Before you can use the object, it must be either connected to a power source or a tank. That's done easily by dragging and dropping nodes from the source to the object. You can connect multiple objects to a single tank or power source but remember you will empty that source faster if you do. Adding more sources of fuel or power will help, but it will increase the mass of your ship which will make it slower to turn.

Moving around a solar system is not a simple manner of pointing your nose at a planet, star or asteriod and then firing your rockets because everything including you is in Newtonian motion. It's like trying to drive a car on ice. You have to kill one direction of motion before attempting to move in a new direction (retrograde burns come to play here) or slow down or speed up at the apogee or perigee points of your orbit. Failure to do this will result in your ship skidding and slidding off course.

For a game that is in alpha, it is very stable. The game cost is insanely reasonable and there is a lot of play value provided you get past the learning curve. There's very little tutorial info here about the game to explain all the basics but two guides written and available on Steam will help you get started. If you keep in sandbox mode, experiment with ship design and orbital mechanics, and ask questions in the community area, you should get the hang of it.

One  thing I would like to see added as  a feature is the clicking of planets to show info on your approach vector (both tangent and radial). You can do this with asteroids but not planets.

A ship editor for creating and modifying a library of ship designs before entering the game would be great as well.

Time dialation for up to 8x speed is not enough to see a discernable change in orbits and intrasolar system travel...perhaps 24 would be more appropriate?

Buy the game! For 3 cups of coffee you get something that will keep you entertained yet challenged for days.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967767593', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 2619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1632, 'last_played': 1632816858}
review:
28 Sept. 2021
J'y ai rejoué régulièrement pour observer le développement et pendant 3 heures aujourd'hui. Il y a beaucoup d'améliorations. Autant en termes de ressources que de design. Il y a aussi un mode "sans gravité" ce qui rend le jeu beaucoup plus simple, mais permet aussi d'y ajouter de l'ia ennemie qui se comportera un peu mieux.
Les vaisseaux sont aussi passés en 3D, avec de nombreux nouveaux block et nouvelles technologies. 
Et a priori, il sera prochainement possible d'atterrir sur les planètes. A voir donc...
Il y a aussi des missions de combats, ou de récoltes.

Je regrette toutefois que le jeu ne dispose pas d'un vrai tutoriel complet. Mais cela reste toute de même facile à prendre en main. Quelques trucs restent obscures, mais il est facile d'expérimenter en mode sandbox (triche avec accès a toutes les tech et ressources).

27 aout 2015: 27h de jeu...

Attention: Le jeu est encore à ses début! Du coup je vais uniquement commenter le contenu actuel, et le plaisir que j'en tire. Si vous n'êtes pas du genre à aimer les sandbox, ou si vous vous attendez à un jeu avec plein de choses à faire...N'achetez pas encore...mettez le jeu en suivit, et attendez quelques mois. Les devs semblent plutôt actifs et très attentifs .

Très important avant de commenter: Il faut vouloir apprendre à l'utiliser. C'est un peu confus au début, mais après un certain temps, on fait tout en quelques click ici et là, et ça devient tout à fait intuitif.

En bref - avant de donner quelques exemples qui m'ont charmés:
Que pouvez vous faire dans le jeu?
- Multijoueur existant, mais pas de serveur (à moins de jouer avec des amis)
- IA et enemie actuellement desactivé suite a certain bug - prochain patch en approche!
- Construire vos propres vaisseaux
- Faire d'un de vos vaisseaux une (ou plusieurs) bases spatiale en orbite
- Vous amarrer a des asteroids, et si vous voulez, en faire des bases de minages...
- Changer d'orbite pour aller cher d'autres roids vers d'autres planete du system solaire
- Concevoir vos propres vaisseaux comme il vous chante
(par exemple, un petit vaisseau d'attaque à petit rayon d'action, ou un gros porteur, ou encore un petit vaisseau satellite)
- Petite note, les devs pense passer le jeu en 2.5D (rendu 3D mais déplacement uniquement sur 2 dimensions)

Ce qui m'a charmé:
Quel plaisir attendre actuellement du jeu?
La gravité dans ce jeu fait tout son charme... Oubliez les déplacement en ligne droite comme dans tous les jeux d'espace...
Ici, si vous voulez aller miner un astéroid, il va falloir viser votre trajectoire d'interception, ralentir, vous arrimer, ou vous aligner à son orbite, ou encore gérer votre propre orbite autour de celui-ci... Du pur bonheur :-)

Encore plus jouissif: l'arrimage aux autres stations... Oubliez les gros coups de freins et l'arrimage façon gros bourin.

Exemple de sensation:
- Vous préparer votre trajectoire pour ratrapper une station.
- Vous êtes en approche rapide, les sas d'arrimage est encore loin, la station est en orbite, mais elle tourne aussi sur elle même.
- Vous vous rapprocher...Belle trajectoire. Mais vous devez également synchroniser votre rotation..
- Vous zoomez pour avoir une meilleure vue.
- Tout bouge encore un peu dans tous les sens, car vous n'êtes pas aligné, ni synchronisé avec la rotation de la station.
- Avec avec vos petits propulseurs vous corrigez votre alignement, doucement, tout doucement, vous vous synchronisez à sa rotation... et soudain!
- L'image se fige presque! 
- Vous êtes synchronisé, quelle sensation! 
- Les sas se rapprochent, et il faut maintenant embrasser doucement la station...
- Un faux coup de propulseurs et il faudra recommencer!
- Click clack! Pshhh! vous êtes docké! Vous déclenchez vos propulseurs pour stopper la rotation.
- Bravo! Envie de recommencer? OUI ! :-)

C'est vraiment là que je suis tombé amoureux de ce jeu. Docker OK, mais aussi travailler les trajectoires. Apprendre à se servir de notre orbite pour économiser du carburant...intercepter les asteroid, miner, et retourner décharger.

Autre exemple: Vous pensez aller tout droit taper sur le joueur qui est un peu plus loin? 
...Pas si facile...
On prépare la trajectoire pour passer pas trop loin et lui mettre quelques salves... Mais celui-ci modifie sa trajectoire... Il vous fait un grand doigt, alors qu'il reste hors de porter et vous regarde vous éloigner ... :-)
Il va falloir attendre une petite révolution autour du soleil pour pouvoir lui faire passer ce geste vulgaire :-)

Côté bug:
Pour ce qui est fait, le jeu est super stable. Il n'a jamais planté. 
Certaines de vos actions vont bouleverser le centre de gravité de votre station et provoquer des situations plutôt amusantes...
Par exemple, votre station qui par en orbite lointaine, super vite, super loin, et en 20 morceaux :-)

On lance la sauvegarde précédentes, pas grave...et en faites, on s'amuse maintenant à voir ce qui se passerait si on faisait autre chose.. Genre exploser un gros réservoir hydrogène  :-)

J'espère que ceci vous aidera à patienter, ou à essayer. 

A+

author: {'steamid': '76561198001329517', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 889, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 522, 'last_played': 1680883009}
review:
When I first started playing I thought it was awful! 
The updates and the ingame text dont always match up, the controls are clunky/impossible.

Then I thought about what I was doing. 
Remember kids make sure your solar panels are plugged into the same battery as your miner ;)

Good:
Engaging/frustrating gameplay
Can learn the basics of flight with sandbox mode on (useful if you manage to nab an asteroid without Al too ;))
Basic game mechanics show SO MUCH potential. 
Warp drive is a ton of fun! 
Stars are so pretty that you can crash into them

Bads:
Havent been through a Dev update so don't know how much progress is made in each update. 
Save/Re-Load causes some headaches (building a mining base only to reload it and have the asteroid no grabbed and crashing into my base).

Even better if:
Flight control was improved/simplified/automated- We don't all have wizard like reflexes and wiping out star ports seems to be my thing...
Drones (mini ships)
Production/trade
NPC combat
In game goals (could support the desperately needed/wanted tutorial)

All in all a good game with great potential. 
Barring the usual early access shennanigans this game could be super,fantastic and amazing :)

Edit: Dev goes bug hunting regularly which is nice - You wont have to wait until a new increment in the Dev cycle before fixes happen :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197990418637', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1440263554}
review:
My initial - and it is a very early comment is that this game is very very very difficult - it isn't obvious in anyway what one is meant to do, let alone how to do it. I know it is an Early Access game and therefore no tutorial, but don't expect to be able to orbit, dock or anything straight off, unless you are well versed in orbital mechanics, and you can work  out what the keys do.

I will continue to try to play for a while - and wait for updates which improve the game play - but this might be one game which despite havig paid for it, it still gets left on the shelf.
developer_response:
Every action have its button on the screen. If you hover your mouse over each button or label. You will have a description about what it's do and its hotkey.

Every module have its description in build menu, when you select any module, you will see information about it and a buttons of all available actions (which is also have descriptions, and can be assigned for any hotkey which you wish).

It is deep and complicated game and you are free to explore it just by hovering your cursor over the visible elements on the screen.

The game have much more descriptions at the current pre-Alpha stage than the most hardcore simulators at the final stage. And we are continue to improving the usability in every update.

If you are found the game too complicated to understand and figured out that it is not a casual arcade, it is not a reason for negative review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100624324', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1471451199}

author: {'steamid': '76561198042143223', 'num_games_owned': 816, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1626201813}
review:
5.1 hours played. never knew i played that long... kinda got lost making ridiculous creations and messing around by flinging rocks at ships...

for it's price i can definightly say it's worth it, the gameplay is a bit... ergh right now but the artwork is amazing. you can tell there's been alot of love put in this game, even the Dev who doesn't speak english as his first language tries very hard to convey dev notes and replys to comments in broken but understandable english! that gets 5 stars from me :D

now the game itself... 

if you don't have an intrest in space or physics in space and orbits and planets and such then yes you are going to have a hard time understanding why your ship is stuck in a circle and why it doesn't just warp to different planets at the push of a button.

but if you have some experience with space games/ semi-realistic space physics then you're going to have about an hour to understand how the game works then another hour understanding how the ship system works but in the end after those two hours you'll have a small ship which can surport itself and defend itself ready to go.

albiet my ship turn to char as soon as my engines got shot out and i flew into the sun but who cares? it was fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198002450718', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1437706583}
review:
EDIT: The dev keeps harassing me about this negative review, and feel the need to add several responses jut to repeat what is cleary labled above, "EARLY ACCESS REVIEW". We know it's early access alright? But when your basic tutorial is a mess a whole year after you release in EA, it probably tells us something about your planning.

First of all, this is another one of those "gather resources and survive" type of games, as if we don't have enoug of those already. 

Second of all, this is has a HUGE learning cliff, and I'm not talking about the orbital mechanics, which alone would drive off most casual player. I'm talking about the most basic things, like how to even build your ship. To even start building, you need to follow these steps:

1) "right click the eingeering bay" as the "tutorial" tells you
1.1) click on every modue because you don't know which is the engineering bay, it's not like the game tells you, maybe when you hove over the part? nope, it doesn't. You just have to click every single module.
1.2) find out that none of the modules brings out the engineering bay and start feeling frustrated.
1.3) figure out that you need to put crew into your engineering bay, like yea why would I not do that? like isn't it basic game design that anything a player would do anyway, should be automatic?
2) press c to bring up the crew panels
3) drag a crew into the engineering bay
4) now right click the engineering bay
5) now you can build things
6) find out that the things you build don't do anything because they need to be connected
6.1) read that the "tutorial" says you need to connect the engines to whatever module 
6.2) find out that you don't know which part is the engine, because again, it doesn't stell you which part is what, at all.
6.3) I see where they're going with this, realistic space ships would have engines like that, but do you really expect normal people to look for engines on the SIDE of a space ship? Wouldn't they loot at the back end? and fall on their face attempting that?
6.4) even though you had to drag the crews for the crew panel, you can't drag the connection nodes, yea it sounds minor but subconsciously you expect consistency from a single game so you try to drag the connection nodes and get frustrated because it doesn't do anything.
6.5) and it's not a simple left click either, nope that would be too straight forward. You see this time it's right click the nodes you want to connect. 
7) find out that the mining laser and the power generators they tell you build have no connectors, even though in the tutorial it tells you to connect them to whatever they have to be connected to.
7.1) find out that in the "guide" section of this game's community page they just tell you to build the mining laser but don't tell you how to use it.
7.2) find out that no matter what you do you can't make the modules do anything what so ever.
8) refund this game and write a negative review.
developer_response:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Updated 27.08.2015: 

The review is no longer actual since the described issues are fixed.

The author didn't noticed our big labels "Early Access" and "Pre-Alpha" and has no any patience.
Additional information about situation with the tutorial can be found here:
http://steamcommunity.com/gid/103582791436739024/announcements/detail/132081775273810780


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Original answer:

As you can see, the game is in pre-alpha state, so the tutorial actually is not ready yet. "Manual", yes, it is a temporary solution. But tutorial with smooth learning curve will be added slightly later.

For now, improvements of game mechanics and bug fixes - it is more important tasks, since the game changes quite often, and tutorial should be changed too. In that case we will spend too much time to recreate tutorial each time when we will change something in the game. We thought everyone can agree with us, that new features is more important.

We hope you will be satisfied with the game if you revisit it when it will be in alpha or beta state. Anyway, thanks for review, we will use it as to-do list to make a better usability.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021378451', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1993, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 507, 'last_played': 1610134863}
review:
[h1] Брать всем, кто любит инди игры!!! [/h1]
[b] [u] Версия игры 0.671 [/u] [/b]
[*] Очень интересная задумка, воплотить 3D космические симуляторы в 2D.
[*] Огромный потенциал.
[*] Удобная система строительства.
[*] Настраиваемы группы действия разных модулей:
      [1] Активировать все дрели или только нужную Вам группу.
      [2] Полеты на ракетных двигателях, а для маневров можно переключить на RCS.
[*] Хорошая анимация динамичных модулей.
[*] Приятная графика.
10\10
P.S. 
Играл [spoiler] на пиратке [/spoiler] и решил поддержать разработчика, цена не кусается, после релиза подорожает.
Заверните 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983748560', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1440499441}
review:
Great game!

Love the orbital physics
Love the complexities of construction/power/mining
Combat rocks! Really easy to loose while winning!
Totally dont mind the learning curve and needing to utilise external tutorials
(DEV's don't waste your time on tutorials yet keep pumping out the content!)

One small gripe though:
It's far to easy to change your orbit when just turning with RCS. I understand and approve that poorly mounted RCS layouts will result in an unstable ship but feel that a multi-ton ship should not be able to accidentally modify it's orbit without a more substantial engine or a constant directional RCS burn.

Overall great work!
This game will be one to watch, especially when people get their hands on the modding API!

I should also mention that the developer seems very involved in the community and is really listening to his fans!

author: {'steamid': '76561198072452506', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1436122546}
review:

developer_response:
It is an Early Access.
Early Access games supposed to be better in future.

But even now, many people enjoying by playing with ship editor, real physics and orbital mechanics.

If you will describe your opinion in more details (not just "G A R B A G E" (this word is more suitable for another kind of games)), it will be much easier for us to make the game better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018665556', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1433805657}
review:
まだ答えを出すには早過ぎる完成度なんでアレですけど、
他の方も言う様に今後の可能性は充分に感じます。

用意されたソーラーシステムと宇宙船を構成するブロックから、
ある程度進むと最終的にやることが一つだけになりそうなので
そこに到達した時点での広がりを期待させてくれる造りになって
くれるならば、大きく化けるのではないかと期待しています。

何も知らずにプレイすると宇宙船を拡張してる最中に
乗組員が全員餓死するのは笑わせてもらいました。

※マルチは試していないのでこれに関してはノーコメント

改めて、今後に期待

author: {'steamid': '76561198013561197', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1436824421}
review: Seems like it will be a good game, but add a tutorial or a way to figure out how to use things.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970931692', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1429721899}
review:
Not enjoyable. this is not a game that you can just drop in and learn to play on your own. You need to rely on various guides and video's. there is NO in-game help what so ever.

I don't mind a steep learning curve, but this game basically starts 20 feet above your head and you need to go find a ladder just to figure out how to turn on your mining lasers.
developer_response:
You are right, the game is not simple and it requires in-game tutorial and smooth learning curve.
But since this is only a pre-alpha - in-game tutorial is not the priority for now.

Instead of that, as a temporary solution we made a Steam guide and added a link to it in main menu.

At the current state of development, In-game tutorial is a complicated thing because the game is in very active development, features may be changed every update, so the tutorial may be outdated at every update.

The game will be a much more user friendly at the Alpha or Beta version. Hope you will change your opinion after that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129101111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1427403152}
review:
Reccomended to keep an eye on, but as it stands - it needs balancing.

Its a fun concept game, a great ammount of effort and detail in it but it almost ends up with too much realism vs fun.

The physics driven and oriented flight is a fun idea, but it struggles at the moment against a balancing act of knowing what to do down to the last inch of space and it tests the player's patience to conserve resources to make the most of what you gain. Over-taxing your thrusters can leave you adrift far too fast at the moment.

The orbiting mechanic and gravity effects are neat, but to me its just out of reach of the perception to make it really sink in well to shift your flight easy. Hard to tell which direction your path is going, ending up with a bit of a problem if you pass the mark too far the wrong way.

Sandboxing is fun and interesting, but its a bit more of a conceptual phase at the moment I would argue than anywhere near a working platform.

Great promise, plenty of heart and attention to detial - just needs that gaming tweak to let the fun aspect sink in.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978534278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 1422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1520696683}
review:
A good concept nicely implemented; A top-down space flight / resource / construction simulator that realistically handles gravity.

Very smooth graphics and gameplay, but you'll need to understand and know how to implement orbital mechanics in order to play this (the latter of which is more difficult than it sounds). Not to mention it has a reasonable power and resource system which is easy to understand.

The developers just implemented multi-player, and it shows; Even for a single-player game you'll have to start a server. This is all done in-game and very clear and easy to understand as well. Not actually tested it, but from what I understand its just as stable as the game itself.

Can't wait to see more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136003398', 'num_games_owned': 68, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1497517810}

author: {'steamid': '76561198053083938', 'num_games_owned': 417, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1593550978}
review:
Very interesting concept. As of right now the game is more of a creative mode kind of thing, but you can easily see how this is going to develop into a very fun game.

It is a great concept game and right now it's nowhere near finished. You may want to hold off on purchasing right now unless you want to pay to help support the development (which I'm sure the developer would greatly appreciate).

I cannot wait for this game to be finished.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059861876', 'num_games_owned': 56, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 6671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6281, 'last_played': 1562524043}
review:
Voilà un jeu très prometteur ! Un peu de science pour le pilotage (mais pas trop), de la stratégie pour les ressources (1+1=?), de la folie dans la construction des vaisseaux,... Rien à voir tout de même avec un simulateur spatial !  En plus, c'est une bande de jeunes (sérieux) donc des joyeux développeurs pour un projet ambitieux ! 

11/2019 : L'aventure continue ! Des nouveautés régulières, une belle communauté... Se faire plaisir dans l'espace : faire du commerce, quelques batailles... :)

11/2017 : 3 ans ! Le projet avance toujours, les mécanismes de jeux sont en place, les petits détails sont comblés/ajoutés, un gros effort a été fait ! A suivre ;)

11/2016 : 2 ans déjà ! Beaucoup de nouveautés : 3D, design,... Plein de chose encore à venir !

12/2015 : Encore un peu de patiente..... mon avis se base sur un développement en cours (accès anticipé = jeu incomplet) !

author: {'steamid': '76561198025051194', 'num_games_owned': 507, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 19426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5547, 'last_played': 1699586998}
review:
I posted this review originally in Feb of 14.  It was much harsher but I toned it down a bit in deference to a PM from a Dev.

It is nearly June.  Major issues with game play have not been addressed. Tthe Devs appear more intent upon adding content  than  fixing what is broken.  Added content will not make Celestial Command playable.

Save your pennies.

---(earlier comment follow)--

This game had an interesting premise.  Build a space ship & mine the asteroids using simulate somewhat realistic orbital mechanics.  There was a solid single player game in the making.

Celestial Command was progressing nicely & becoming a playable game.  Then a couple months the Devs decided to focus all of their attention on multiplayer.

Now long standing serious bugs are not being addressed.   Content is no longer being added.  Prior content is left incomplete.

If you  purchase CelCom based upon your expectations of the finished product, be willing put  up with some serious playability issues.

If the bugs get stomped and this game comes together it should be worh the wait.

@Artanni: I think that MP is more important to the devs than it is to the players.
developer_response:
Ok, you are think that "good game" right now - it is better than "very good game" in the nearest future. This is your opinion and we do not arguing with it.

But we still prefer to use the "path of maximum efficiency", which means that multiplayer at the early stages is much more easier to implement than at the later stage.

By the way, we warn each buyers that this is not fully playable game.

Hope you will change your opinion after next few updates.

----
Further discussion of this situations can be found [url=http://steamcommunity.com/app/330460/discussions/0/610573567804369246/]there.[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198149235997', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1674158111}

author: {'steamid': '76561198085037263', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1460335666}
review:
For a small playthrough I hav efound two things that or annoyance, lack of a small tutorial or quick to refer to help page, and build mode not disabling engines. It's a little frustrating to have to pause the game while you build, so that you won't fly drunkely all over the place. Otherwise, I love it!

It's really enjoyable and after getting a hang of everything I feel like I'm really going to be having fun with the game, a Mirror function would be nice to have for making Symetrycal ships, but that's really it.

Flying and having to constantly be aware of your heading as well as where you're headed as far as gravity goes is amazingly fun and  I can't wait to get even deeper into things.

another hope for this game is that they release a modding API so that people can build upon the work these three wonderful beings have already done to provide an ever greater variety to the game.


TL;DR :

This game is amazingly fun and very esoteric right now (especially with it's lack of tutorials), but if you're patient you'll have en extremely deep game that won't be very forgiving on mistakes because gravity actually affects you. You also look liek you'll be requiring food and a myriad of other supplies to keep you and your crew alive by what is seen right now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080592846', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1420917596}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993373280', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1468459149}
review:
This game is my first purchase of the "Build your own ship" genre that seems to be budding in the indie game world, so I have nothing to compare it against.

I really wanted to NOT recomend this game but it wouldn't be fair to the developers, they are doing a pretty good job at keeping the community updated on progress and sending out changes rather quickly. At the momment this is a bare bones space sim with (most) of the merciless physics of space. 

The negatives (as of November 30th, 2014--keep that in mind and read the changes logs)
No storyline. Bad guys look like your ships. Have a basic AI.
No missions
No use for some of the mining resources.
No in game tutorial. Read the guides first. Lots of information is missing at the momment or not apparent. I expect that to change.
No mercy for the uninitiated. Fuel runs out and you'll be spinning and or zooming off to the great unknown.

The good (again as of November 30th)
Quick to play space ship sim. Guides are a quick read.
Easy to build ships. Again, no tutorial yet but its not too hard to figure out.
Physics! Also a curse if you want a action game. Things float away. Explosions send you (or your enemy) zooming away. The more mass you have the more fuel you consume. Fuel is a big deal here. Pesky objects block your solar panels preventing you from powering your defences.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046618476', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1562645920}

author: {'steamid': '76561198028982723', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1603120045}
review:
This is one of those gems that need and deserve more attention. So far only 6 reviews have been placed. Meaning, probably not many players have this game or know about it.

For anyone thinking of buying the game, i'll explain to you why you should.

[h1]The price [/h1]
The price of when buying while it's still early access, is just 7,99 EUR. Not so sure about other currencies. This isn't much. When it's fully released, it will be doubled [spoiler]If im right[/spoiler]

[h1]Gameplay [/h1]
The gameplay is very smooth. Especially for an early access title. The amount of things you can do is pretty limited at the moment, but of what the developers have told us, this will be much more fun to play. Don't get me wrong. I'm already enjoying this alot. 

What im excited about the most, is the amount of updates and the developer-community relationship. The developers actually view the discussions, reviews and questions. And update the game according to what the people want to see.

My personal favorite will be multiplayer.

And while im at it, will there be planet interactions? Something i would really love to see is being able to inhabit a planet and build al kinds of structures on it. Miners, defence systems, that kind of stuff. And automated transporting between those planets using actual npc ships or something. Gives the player the feeling of power and accomplishment.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978136507', 'num_games_owned': 1468, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1580077867}
review:
At first glance Celestial Command just looks like just another spaceship game, but if you take time to play it you will discover a very well designed sandbox experience. Even though the game is at a very early stage in development a lot of the really important features are there to enjoy. 

At this stage in development you can free build whatever ship your heart desires. Want to build a small mining ship to collect everything in the solar system, or what about a battleship to kill everything that comes across your path? All of this and much more can be built. The building mechanics themselves are intuitive and easy thanks to a snap in style feature. You can easily see what components will snap in to a given space and if you have any free points left. The only complaint I have to building is the unintuitive linking feature the modules use to become operational. Now, the feature isn’t bad in any right, in fact I love that everything has to be connected to work. My issue is that I have nothing to show me how or what to link in order to activate the module. Of course this issue can be easily fixed with a small tutorial for the game. 

After playing the game for a while I discovered the physics to be very well done. If you are familiar with any type of realistic orbital mechanics then you will feel right at home. If you are not then it may take some getting used to. The mechanics remind me a lot of Kerbal Space Program and at times Celestial Command feels like a 2D version of it. Of course in my case this is a good thing. The realistic mechanics give the game a welcomed challenge and add another layer of fun and experimentation. 

The overall design of the game is great from what I have seen up to this point. Although the game is being made in a 2D space the design is crisp and well done. When playing in HD all the textures and models look great. I will definitely look forward to seeing more from the team.

Overall I would say development is coming along nicely. Of course you can see that at the time of this review the game has just released. With that being said, even at its current state the game is well worth the price. If you are looking for a fun game in which you truly free build any ship, fly through realistic space physics to kill and mine then what are you waiting for?


[b]It should go without saying but this is a review for the current EARLY ACCESS version of the game. If you buy the game it is at your own risk.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198042382814', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1585559108}
review:
Внимание! Это ранний доступ и все может измениться!

Купил эту игру дважды и ни капли не пожалел. Да, ранний доступ. Да, многое не работает. Да, многого еще нет.
Но это, черт возьми, именно то, чего бы я хотел. Реальная физика, не очень глубокий (пока), но весьма затягивающий геймплей, создание кораблей, которые иначе как порождениями чьего-то сумрачного гения и не назовешь.

Стоит ли сейчас покупать эту игру?
Скорее нет, чем да.
Если вы хотите готовую игру, то ждите релиза. 
Если вы хотите пройти вместе с разработчиками все перепетии движения к релизу, если хотите помочь им в развитии проекта, то выбор однозначен - ДА.

Я сделал свой выбор. Сделай выбор и ты.

P.S. Так и не понял, куда отправлять ~220 рублей за каждую копию игры. Ибо изначальная стоимость раннего доступа планировалась в районе 8$.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988234824', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 404, 'last_played': 1630238393}

I've been waiting for a game like this for a long long time. This isn't your typical arcade/causal nonsense - the game is as sophisticated as the games I was raised on and it takes realistic space to a whole new level.

Be advised that the game is still in early development and is nowhere near fully playable. Still, I'm waiting eagerly for updates.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990662682', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1449294653}
review: EVEN WITH THE TUTORIAL i CANT MOVE, KINDA WANT A REFUND
developer_response:
Hi, no need to shout. The game was released only 2 days ago and it is updated almost every day.

We already wrote a guide on basic controls. But we can repeat, in order to make your ship move you need to build the maneuvering engine, fuel tank with hydrogen and connect them together.

In the next update we plan to make this process is more intuitive for new players. Please check the announcements in our community hub for information about updates and future plans.

We can't refund you, but this is not necessary, sure you will be satisfied with the game after a few updates and we hope you will change your review after that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072380091', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 467, 'last_played': 1478307103}

Has the potential to be a very unique and great game though.
developer_response: Thanks you for your review! We're glad that you like our project even on this early stage.
